35#include <isc/aes.h>
36#else
37#include <isc/hmac.h>

40#include <dns/acl.h>

45#include <dns/dispatch.h>
46#include <dns/dnstap.h>

48#include <dns/edns.h>
49#include <dns/events.h>
50#include <dns/forward.h>
51#include <dns/keytable.h>
52#include <dns/log.h>
53#include <dns/message.h>
54#include <dns/ncache.h>
55#include <dns/nsec.h>
56#include <dns/nsec3.h>

59#include <dns/rbt.h>
60#include <dns/rcode.h>
61#include <dns/rdata.h>
62#include <dns/rdataclass.h>
63#include <dns/rdatalist.h>
64#include <dns/rdataset.h>
65#include <dns/rdatastruct.h>
66#include <dns/rdatatype.h>
67#include <dns/resolver.h>
68#include <dns/result.h>
69#include <dns/rootns.h>
70#include <dns/stats.h>
71#include <dns/tsig.h>
72#include <dns/validator.h>
73#ifdef WANT_QUERYTRACE
74#define RTRACE(m) isc_log_write(dns_lctx, \
75 DNS_LOGCATEGORY_RESOLVER, \
76 DNS_LOGMODULE_RESOLVER, \
77 ISC_LOG_DEBUG(3), \
78 "res %p: %s", res, (m))
79#define RRTRACE(r, m) isc_log_write(dns_lctx, \
80 DNS_LOGCATEGORY_RESOLVER, \
81 DNS_LOGMODULE_RESOLVER, \
82 ISC_LOG_DEBUG(3), \
83 "res %p: %s", (r), (m))
84#define FCTXTRACE(m) \
85 isc_log_write(dns_lctx, \
86 DNS_LOGCATEGORY_RESOLVER, \
87 DNS_LOGMODULE_RESOLVER, \
88 ISC_LOG_DEBUG(3), \
89 "fctx %p(%s): %s", \
90 fctx, fctx->info, (m))
91#define FCTXTRACE2(m1, m2) \
92 isc_log_write(dns_lctx, \
93 DNS_LOGCATEGORY_RESOLVER, \
94 DNS_LOGMODULE_RESOLVER, \
95 ISC_LOG_DEBUG(3), \
96 "fctx %p(%s): %s %s", \
97 fctx, fctx->info, (m1), (m2))
98#define FCTXTRACE3(m, res) \
99 isc_log_write(dns_lctx, \
100 DNS_LOGCATEGORY_RESOLVER, \
101 DNS_LOGMODULE_RESOLVER, \
102 ISC_LOG_DEBUG(3), \
103 "fctx %p(%s): [result: %s] %s", \
104 fctx, fctx->info, \
105 isc_result_totext(res), (m))
106#define FCTXTRACE4(m1, m2, res) \
107 isc_log_write(dns_lctx, \
108 DNS_LOGCATEGORY_RESOLVER, \
109 DNS_LOGMODULE_RESOLVER, \
110 ISC_LOG_DEBUG(3), \
111 "fctx %p(%s): [result: %s] %s %s", \
112 fctx, fctx->info, \
113 isc_result_totext(res), (m1), (m2))
114#define FCTXTRACE5(m1, m2, v) \
115 isc_log_write(dns_lctx, \
116 DNS_LOGCATEGORY_RESOLVER, \
117 DNS_LOGMODULE_RESOLVER, \
118 ISC_LOG_DEBUG(3), \
119 "fctx %p(%s): %s %s%u", \
120 fctx, fctx->info, (m1), (m2), (v))
121#define FTRACE(m) isc_log_write(dns_lctx, \
122 DNS_LOGCATEGORY_RESOLVER, \
123 DNS_LOGMODULE_RESOLVER, \
124 ISC_LOG_DEBUG(3), \
125 "fetch %p (fctx %p(%s)): %s", \
126 fetch, fetch->private, \
127 fetch->private->info, (m))
128#define QTRACE(m) isc_log_write(dns_lctx, \
129 DNS_LOGCATEGORY_RESOLVER, \
130 DNS_LOGMODULE_RESOLVER, \
131 ISC_LOG_DEBUG(3), \
132 "resquery %p (fctx %p(%s)): %s", \
133 query, query->fctx, \
134 query->fctx->info, (m))
135#else
136#define RTRACE(m) do { UNUSED(m); } while (/*CONSTCOND*/0)
137#define RRTRACE(r, m) do { UNUSED(r); UNUSED(m); } while (/*CONSTCOND*/0)
138#define FCTXTRACE(m) do { UNUSED(m); } while (/*CONSTCOND*/0)
139#define FCTXTRACE2(m1, m2) do { UNUSED(m1); UNUSED(m2); } while (/*CONSTCOND*/0)
140#define FCTXTRACE3(m1, res) do { UNUSED(m1); UNUSED(res); } while (/*CONSTCOND*/0)
141#define FCTXTRACE4(m1, m2, res) \
142 do { UNUSED(m1); UNUSED(m2); UNUSED(res); } while (/*CONSTCOND*/0)
143#define FCTXTRACE5(m1, m2, v) \
144 do { UNUSED(m1); UNUSED(m2); UNUSED(v); } while (/*CONSTCOND*/0)
145#define FTRACE(m) do { UNUSED(m); } while (/*CONSTCOND*/0)
146#define QTRACE(m) do { UNUSED(m); } while (/*CONSTCOND*/0)
147#endif /* WANT_QUERYTRACE */
148
149#define US_PER_SEC 1000000U
150#define US_PER_MSEC 1000U
151/*
152 * The maximum time we will wait for a single query.
153 */
154#define MAX_SINGLE_QUERY_TIMEOUT 9000U
155#define MAX_SINGLE_QUERY_TIMEOUT_US (MAX_SINGLE_QUERY_TIMEOUT*US_PER_MSEC)
156
157/*
158 * We need to allow a individual query time to complete / timeout.
159 */
160#define MINIMUM_QUERY_TIMEOUT (MAX_SINGLE_QUERY_TIMEOUT + 1000U)
161
162/* The default time in seconds for the whole query to live. */
163#ifndef DEFAULT_QUERY_TIMEOUT
164#define DEFAULT_QUERY_TIMEOUT MINIMUM_QUERY_TIMEOUT
165#endif
166
167/* The maximum time in seconds for the whole query to live. */
168#ifndef MAXIMUM_QUERY_TIMEOUT
169#define MAXIMUM_QUERY_TIMEOUT 30000
170#endif
171
172/* The default maximum number of recursions to follow before giving up. */
173#ifndef DEFAULT_RECURSION_DEPTH
174#define DEFAULT_RECURSION_DEPTH 7
175#endif
176
177/* The default maximum number of iterative queries to allow before giving up. */
178#ifndef DEFAULT_MAX_QUERIES
179#define DEFAULT_MAX_QUERIES 75
180#endif
181
182/* Number of hash buckets for zone counters */
183#ifndef RES_DOMAIN_BUCKETS
184#define RES_DOMAIN_BUCKETS 523
185#endif
186#define RES_NOBUCKET 0xffffffff
187
188/*%
189 * Maximum EDNS0 input packet size.
190 */
191#define RECV_BUFFER_SIZE 4096 /* XXXRTH Constant. */
192
193/*%
194 * This defines the maximum number of timeouts we will permit before we
195 * disable EDNS0 on the query.
196 */
197#define MAX_EDNS0_TIMEOUTS 3
198
199#define DNS_RESOLVER_BADCACHESIZE 1021
200#define DNS_RESOLVER_BADCACHETTL(fctx) \
201 (((fctx)->res->lame_ttl > 30 ) ? (fctx)->res->lame_ttl : 30)
202
203typedef struct fetchctx fetchctx_t;
204
205typedef struct query {
206 /* Locked by task event serialization. */
207 unsigned int magic;
208 fetchctx_t * fctx;
209 isc_mem_t * mctx;
210 dns_dispatchmgr_t * dispatchmgr;
211 dns_dispatch_t * dispatch;
212 bool exclusivesocket;
213 dns_adbaddrinfo_t * addrinfo;
214 isc_socket_t * tcpsocket;
215 isc_time_t start;
216 dns_messageid_t id;
217 dns_dispentry_t * dispentry;
218 ISC_LINK(struct query) link;
219 isc_buffer_t buffer;
220 isc_buffer_t *tsig;
221 dns_tsigkey_t *tsigkey;
222 isc_socketevent_t sendevent;
223 isc_dscp_t dscp;
224 int ednsversion;
225 unsigned int options;
226 isc_sockeventattr_t attributes;
227 unsigned int sends;
228 unsigned int connects;
229 unsigned int udpsize;
230 unsigned char data[512];
231} resquery_t;
232
233struct tried {
234 isc_sockaddr_t addr;
235 unsigned int count;
236 ISC_LINK(struct tried) link;
237};
238
239#define QUERY_MAGIC ISC_MAGIC('Q', '!', '!', '!')
240#define VALID_QUERY(query) ISC_MAGIC_VALID(query, QUERY_MAGIC)
241
242#define RESQUERY_ATTR_CANCELED 0x02
243
244#define RESQUERY_CONNECTING(q) ((q)->connects > 0)
245#define RESQUERY_CANCELED(q) (((q)->attributes & \
246 RESQUERY_ATTR_CANCELED) != 0)
247#define RESQUERY_SENDING(q) ((q)->sends > 0)
248
249typedef enum {
250 fetchstate_init = 0, /*%< Start event has not run yet. */
251 fetchstate_active,
252 fetchstate_done /*%< FETCHDONE events posted. */
253} fetchstate;
254
255typedef enum {
256 badns_unreachable = 0,
257 badns_response,
258 badns_validation,
259 badns_forwarder,
260} badnstype_t;
261
262struct fetchctx {
263 /*% Not locked. */
264 unsigned int magic;
265 dns_resolver_t * res;
266 dns_name_t name;
267 dns_rdatatype_t type;
268 unsigned int options;
269 unsigned int bucketnum;
270 unsigned int dbucketnum;
271 char * info;
272 isc_mem_t * mctx;
273 isc_stdtime_t now;
274
275 /*% Locked by appropriate bucket lock. */
276 fetchstate state;
277 bool want_shutdown;
278 bool cloned;
279 bool spilled;
280 unsigned int references;
281 isc_event_t control_event;
282 ISC_LINK(struct fetchctx) link;
283 ISC_LIST(dns_fetchevent_t) events;
284
285 /*% Locked by task event serialization. */
286 dns_name_t domain;
287 dns_rdataset_t nameservers;
288 unsigned int attributes;
289 isc_timer_t * timer;
290 isc_time_t expires;
291 isc_interval_t interval;
292 dns_message_t * qmessage;
293 dns_message_t * rmessage;
294 ISC_LIST(resquery_t) queries;
295 dns_adbfindlist_t finds;
296 dns_adbfind_t * find;
297 dns_adbfindlist_t altfinds;
298 dns_adbfind_t * altfind;
299 dns_adbaddrinfolist_t forwaddrs;
300 dns_adbaddrinfolist_t altaddrs;
301 dns_forwarderlist_t forwarders;
302 dns_fwdpolicy_t fwdpolicy;
303 isc_sockaddrlist_t bad;
304 ISC_LIST(struct tried) edns;
305 ISC_LIST(struct tried) edns512;
306 isc_sockaddrlist_t bad_edns;
307 dns_validator_t * validator;
308 ISC_LIST(dns_validator_t) validators;
309 dns_db_t * cache;
310 dns_adb_t * adb;
311 bool ns_ttl_ok;
312 uint32_t ns_ttl;
313 isc_counter_t * qc;
314 bool minimized;
315 unsigned int qmin_labels;
316 isc_result_t qmin_warning;
317 bool ip6arpaskip;
318 bool forwarding;
319 dns_name_t qminname;
320 dns_rdatatype_t qmintype;
321 dns_fetch_t * qminfetch;
322 dns_rdataset_t qminrrset;
323 dns_name_t qmindcname;
324
325 /*%
326 * The number of events we're waiting for.
327 */
328 unsigned int pending;
329
330 /*%
331 * The number of times we've "restarted" the current
332 * nameserver set. This acts as a failsafe to prevent
333 * us from pounding constantly on a particular set of
334 * servers that, for whatever reason, are not giving
335 * us useful responses, but are responding in such a
336 * way that they are not marked "bad".
337 */
338 unsigned int restarts;
339
340 /*%
341 * The number of timeouts that have occurred since we
342 * last successfully received a response packet. This
343 * is used for EDNS0 black hole detection.
344 */
345 unsigned int timeouts;
346
347 /*%
348 * Look aside state for DS lookups.
349 */
350 dns_name_t nsname;
351 dns_fetch_t * nsfetch;
352 dns_rdataset_t nsrrset;
353
354 /*%
355 * Number of queries that reference this context.
356 */
357 unsigned int nqueries;
358
359 /*%
360 * The reason to print when logging a successful
361 * response to a query.
362 */
363 const char * reason;
364
365 /*%
366 * Random numbers to use for mixing up server addresses.
367 */
368 uint32_t rand_buf;
369 uint32_t rand_bits;
370
371 /*%
372 * Fetch-local statistics for detailed logging.
373 */
374 isc_result_t result; /*%< fetch result */
375 isc_result_t vresult; /*%< validation result */
376 int exitline;
377 isc_time_t start;
378 uint64_t duration;
379 bool logged;
380 unsigned int querysent;
381 unsigned int referrals;
382 unsigned int lamecount;
383 unsigned int quotacount;
384 unsigned int neterr;
385 unsigned int badresp;
386 unsigned int adberr;
387 unsigned int findfail;
388 unsigned int valfail;
389 bool timeout;
390 dns_adbaddrinfo_t *addrinfo;
391 const isc_sockaddr_t *client;
392 dns_messageid_t id;
393 unsigned int depth;
394};
395
396#define FCTX_MAGIC ISC_MAGIC('F', '!', '!', '!')
397#define VALID_FCTX(fctx) ISC_MAGIC_VALID(fctx, FCTX_MAGIC)
398
399#define FCTX_ATTR_HAVEANSWER 0x0001
400#define FCTX_ATTR_GLUING 0x0002
401#define FCTX_ATTR_ADDRWAIT 0x0004
402#define FCTX_ATTR_SHUTTINGDOWN 0x0008
403#define FCTX_ATTR_WANTCACHE 0x0010
404#define FCTX_ATTR_WANTNCACHE 0x0020
405#define FCTX_ATTR_NEEDEDNS0 0x0040
406#define FCTX_ATTR_TRIEDFIND 0x0080
407#define FCTX_ATTR_TRIEDALT 0x0100
408
409#define HAVE_ANSWER(f) (((f)->attributes & FCTX_ATTR_HAVEANSWER) != \
410 0)
411#define GLUING(f) (((f)->attributes & FCTX_ATTR_GLUING) != \
412 0)
413#define ADDRWAIT(f) (((f)->attributes & FCTX_ATTR_ADDRWAIT) != \
414 0)
415#define SHUTTINGDOWN(f) (((f)->attributes & FCTX_ATTR_SHUTTINGDOWN) \
416 != 0)
417#define WANTCACHE(f) (((f)->attributes & FCTX_ATTR_WANTCACHE) != 0)
418#define WANTNCACHE(f) (((f)->attributes & FCTX_ATTR_WANTNCACHE) != 0)
419#define NEEDEDNS0(f) (((f)->attributes & FCTX_ATTR_NEEDEDNS0) != 0)
420#define TRIEDFIND(f) (((f)->attributes & FCTX_ATTR_TRIEDFIND) != 0)
421#define TRIEDALT(f) (((f)->attributes & FCTX_ATTR_TRIEDALT) != 0)
422
423typedef struct {
424 dns_adbaddrinfo_t * addrinfo;
425 fetchctx_t * fctx;
426} dns_valarg_t;
427
428struct dns_fetch {
429 unsigned int magic;
430 isc_mem_t * mctx;
431 fetchctx_t * private;
432};
433
434#define DNS_FETCH_MAGIC ISC_MAGIC('F', 't', 'c', 'h')
435#define DNS_FETCH_VALID(fetch) ISC_MAGIC_VALID(fetch, DNS_FETCH_MAGIC)
436
437typedef struct fctxbucket {
438 isc_task_t * task;
439 isc_mutex_t lock;
440 ISC_LIST(fetchctx_t) fctxs;
441 bool exiting;
442 isc_mem_t * mctx;
443} fctxbucket_t;
444
445typedef struct fctxcount fctxcount_t;
446struct fctxcount {
447 dns_fixedname_t fdname;
448 dns_name_t *domain;
449 uint32_t count;
450 uint32_t allowed;
451 uint32_t dropped;
452 isc_stdtime_t logged;
453 ISC_LINK(fctxcount_t) link;
454};
455
456typedef struct zonebucket {
457 isc_mutex_t lock;
458 isc_mem_t *mctx;
459 ISC_LIST(fctxcount_t) list;
460} zonebucket_t;
461
462typedef struct alternate {
463 bool isaddress;
464 union {
465 isc_sockaddr_t addr;
466 struct {
467 dns_name_t name;
468 in_port_t port;
469 } _n;
470 } _u;
471 ISC_LINK(struct alternate) link;
472} alternate_t;
473
474struct dns_resolver {
475 /* Unlocked. */
476 unsigned int magic;
477 isc_mem_t * mctx;
478 isc_mutex_t lock;
479 isc_mutex_t nlock;
480 isc_mutex_t primelock;
481 dns_rdataclass_t rdclass;
482 isc_socketmgr_t * socketmgr;
483 isc_timermgr_t * timermgr;
484 isc_taskmgr_t * taskmgr;
485 dns_view_t * view;
486 bool frozen;
487 unsigned int options;
488 dns_dispatchmgr_t * dispatchmgr;
489 dns_dispatchset_t * dispatches4;
490 bool exclusivev4;
491 dns_dispatchset_t * dispatches6;
492 isc_dscp_t querydscp4;
493 isc_dscp_t querydscp6;
494 bool exclusivev6;
495 unsigned int nbuckets;
496 fctxbucket_t * buckets;
497 zonebucket_t * dbuckets;
498 uint32_t lame_ttl;
499 ISC_LIST(alternate_t) alternates;
500 uint16_t udpsize;
501#if USE_ALGLOCK
502 isc_rwlock_t alglock;
503#endif
504 dns_rbt_t * algorithms;
505 dns_rbt_t * digests;
506#if USE_MBSLOCK
507 isc_rwlock_t mbslock;
508#endif
509 dns_rbt_t * mustbesecure;
510 unsigned int spillatmax;
511 unsigned int spillatmin;
512 isc_timer_t * spillattimer;
513 bool zero_no_soa_ttl;
514 unsigned int query_timeout;
515 unsigned int maxdepth;
516 unsigned int maxqueries;
517 isc_result_t quotaresp[2];
518
519 /* Additions for serve-stale feature. */
520 unsigned int retryinterval; /* in milliseconds */
521 unsigned int nonbackofftries;
522
523 /* Locked by lock. */
524 unsigned int references;
525 bool exiting;
526 isc_eventlist_t whenshutdown;
527 unsigned int activebuckets;
528 bool priming;
529 unsigned int spillat; /* clients-per-query */
530 unsigned int zspill; /* fetches-per-zone */
531
532 dns_badcache_t * badcache; /* Bad cache. */
533
534 /* Locked by primelock. */
535 dns_fetch_t * primefetch;
536 /* Locked by nlock. */
537 unsigned int nfctx;
538};
539
540#define RES_MAGIC ISC_MAGIC('R', 'e', 's', '!')
541#define VALID_RESOLVER(res) ISC_MAGIC_VALID(res, RES_MAGIC)
542
543/*%
544 * Private addrinfo flags. These must not conflict with DNS_FETCHOPT_NOEDNS0
545 * (0x008) which we also use as an addrinfo flag.
546 */
547#define FCTX_ADDRINFO_MARK 0x00001
548#define FCTX_ADDRINFO_FORWARDER 0x01000
549#define FCTX_ADDRINFO_EDNSOK 0x04000
550#define FCTX_ADDRINFO_NOCOOKIE 0x08000
551#define FCTX_ADDRINFO_BADCOOKIE 0x10000
552
553#define UNMARKED(a) (((a)->flags & FCTX_ADDRINFO_MARK) \
554 == 0)
555#define ISFORWARDER(a) (((a)->flags & \
556 FCTX_ADDRINFO_FORWARDER) != 0)
557#define NOCOOKIE(a) (((a)->flags & \
558 FCTX_ADDRINFO_NOCOOKIE) != 0)
559#define EDNSOK(a) (((a)->flags & \
560 FCTX_ADDRINFO_EDNSOK) != 0)
561#define BADCOOKIE(a) (((a)->flags & \
562 FCTX_ADDRINFO_BADCOOKIE) != 0)
563
564
565#define NXDOMAIN(r) (((r)->attributes & DNS_RDATASETATTR_NXDOMAIN) != 0)
566#define NEGATIVE(r) (((r)->attributes & DNS_RDATASETATTR_NEGATIVE) != 0)
567
568#define NXDOMAIN_RESULT(r) ((r) == DNS_R_NXDOMAIN || \
569 (r) == DNS_R_NCACHENXDOMAIN)
570#define NXRRSET_RESULT(r) ((r) == DNS_R_NCACHENXRRSET || \
571 (r) == DNS_R_NXRRSET || \
572 (r) == DNS_R_HINTNXRRSET)
573
574#ifdef ENABLE_AFL
575bool dns_fuzzing_resolver = false;
576void dns_resolver_setfuzzing() {
577 dns_fuzzing_resolver = true;
578}
579#endif
580
581static unsigned char ip6_arpa_data[] = "\003IP6\004ARPA";
582static unsigned char ip6_arpa_offsets[] = { 0, 4, 9 };
583static const dns_name_t ip6_arpa =
584 DNS_NAME_INITABSOLUTE(ip6_arpa_data, ip6_arpa_offsets);
585
586static void destroy(dns_resolver_t *res);
587static void empty_bucket(dns_resolver_t *res);
588static isc_result_t resquery_send(resquery_t *query);
589static void resquery_response(isc_task_t *task, isc_event_t *event);
590static void resquery_connected(isc_task_t *task, isc_event_t *event);
591static void fctx_try(fetchctx_t *fctx, bool retrying,
592 bool badcache);
593static isc_result_t fctx_minimize_qname(fetchctx_t *fctx);
594static void fctx_destroy(fetchctx_t *fctx);
595static bool fctx_unlink(fetchctx_t *fctx);
596static isc_result_t ncache_adderesult(dns_message_t *message,
597 dns_db_t *cache, dns_dbnode_t *node,
598 dns_rdatatype_t covers,
599 isc_stdtime_t now,
600 dns_ttl_t minttl,
601 dns_ttl_t maxttl,
602 bool optout,
603 bool secure,
604 dns_rdataset_t *ardataset,
605 isc_result_t *eresultp);
606static void validated(isc_task_t *task, isc_event_t *event);
607static bool maybe_destroy(fetchctx_t *fctx, bool locked);
608static void add_bad(fetchctx_t *fctx, dns_adbaddrinfo_t *addrinfo,
609 isc_result_t reason, badnstype_t badtype);
610static inline isc_result_t findnoqname(fetchctx_t *fctx, dns_name_t *name,
611 dns_rdatatype_t type,
612 dns_name_t **noqname);
613static void fctx_increference(fetchctx_t *fctx);
614static bool fctx_decreference(fetchctx_t *fctx);
615static void resume_qmin(isc_task_t *task, isc_event_t *event);
616
617/*%
618 * The structure and functions defined below implement the resolver
619 * query (resquery) response handling logic.
620 *
621 * When a resolver query is sent and a response is received, the
622 * resquery_response() event handler is run, which calls the rctx_*()
623 * functions. The respctx_t structure maintains state from function
624 * to function.
625 *
626 * The call flow is described below:
627 *
628 * 1. resquery_response():
629 * - Initialize a respctx_t structure (rctx_respinit()).
630 * - Check for dispatcher failure (rctx_dispfail()).
631 * - Parse the response (rctx_parse()).
632 * - Log the response (rctx_logpacket()).
633 * - Check the parsed response for an OPT record and handle
634 * EDNS (rctx_opt(), rctx_edns()).
635 * - Check for a bad or lame server (rctx_badserver(), rctx_lameserver()).
636 * - Handle delegation-only zones (rctx_delonly_zone()).
637 * - If RCODE and ANCOUNT suggest this is a positive answer, and
638 * if so, call rctx_answer(): go to step 2.
639 * - If RCODE and NSCOUNT suggest this is a negative answer or a
640 * referral, call rctx_answer_none(): go to step 4.
641 * - Check the additional section for data that should be cached
642 * (rctx_additional()).
643 * - Clean up and finish by calling rctx_done(): go to step 5.
644 *
645 * 2. rctx_answer():
646 * - If the answer appears to be positive, call rctx_answer_positive():
647 * go to step 3.
648 * - If the response is a malformed delegation (with glue or NS records
649 * in the answer section), call rctx_answer_none(): go to step 4.
650 *
651 * 3. rctx_answer_positive():
652 * - Initialize the portions of respctx_t needed for processing an answer
653 * (rctx_answer_init()).
654 * - Scan the answer section to find records that are responsive to the
655 * query (rctx_answer_scan()).
656 * - For whichever type of response was found, call a separate routine
657 * to handle it: matching QNAME/QTYPE (rctx_answer_match()),
658 * CNAME (rctx_answer_cname()), covering DNAME (rctx_answer_dname()),
659 * or any records returned in response to a query of type ANY
660 * (rctx_answer_any()).
661 * - Scan the authority section for NS or other records that may be
662 * included with a positive answer (rctx_authority_scan()).
663 *
664 * 4. rctx_answer_none():
665 * - Determine whether this is an NXDOMAIN, NXRRSET, or referral.
666 * - If referral, set up the resolver to follow the delegation
667 * (rctx_referral()).
668 * - If NXDOMAIN/NXRRSET, scan the authority section for NS and SOA
669 * records included with a negative response (rctx_authority_negative()),
670 * then for DNSSEC proof of nonexistence (rctx_authority_dnssec()).
671 *
672 * 5. rctx_done():
673 * - Set up chasing of DS records if needed (rctx_chaseds()).
674 * - If the response wasn't intended for us, wait for another response
675 * from the dispatcher (rctx_next()).
676 * - If there is a problem with the responding server, set up another
677 * query to a different server (rctx_nextserver()).
678 * - If there is a problem that might be temporary or dependent on
679 * EDNS options, set up another query to the same server with changed
680 * options (rctx_resend()).
681 * - Shut down the fetch context.
682 */
683
684typedef struct respctx {
685 isc_task_t *task;
686 dns_dispatchevent_t *devent;
687 resquery_t *query;
688 fetchctx_t *fctx;
689 isc_result_t result;
690 unsigned int retryopts; /* updated options to pass to
691 * fctx_query() when resending */
692
693 dns_rdatatype_t type; /* type being sought (set to
694 * ANY if qtype was SIG or RRSIG) */
695 bool aa; /* authoritative answer? */
696 dns_trust_t trust; /* answer trust level */
697 bool chaining; /* CNAME/DNAME processing? */
698 bool next_server; /* give up, try the next server */
699
700 badnstype_t broken_type; /* type of name server problem */
701 isc_result_t broken_server;
702
703 bool get_nameservers; /* get a new NS rrset at zone cut? */
704 bool resend; /* resend this query? */
705 bool nextitem; /* invalid response; keep
706 * listening for the correct one */
707 bool truncated; /* response was truncated */
708 bool no_response; /* no response was received */
709 bool glue_in_answer; /* glue may be in the answer section */
710 bool ns_in_answer; /* NS may be in the answer section */
711 bool negative; /* is this a negative response? */
712
713 isc_stdtime_t now; /* time info */
714 isc_time_t tnow;
715 isc_time_t *finish;
716
717 unsigned int dname_labels;
718 unsigned int domain_labels; /* range of permissible number of
719 * labels in a DNAME */
720
721 dns_name_t *aname; /* answer name */
722 dns_rdataset_t *ardataset; /* answer rdataset */
723
724 dns_name_t *cname; /* CNAME name */
725 dns_rdataset_t *crdataset; /* CNAME rdataset */
726
727 dns_name_t *dname; /* DNAME name */
728 dns_rdataset_t *drdataset; /* DNAME rdataset */
729
730 dns_name_t *ns_name; /* NS name */
731 dns_rdataset_t *ns_rdataset; /* NS rdataset */
732
733 dns_name_t *soa_name; /* SOA name in a negative answer */
734 dns_name_t *ds_name; /* DS name in a negative answer */
735
736 dns_name_t *found_name; /* invalid name in negative response */
737 dns_rdatatype_t found_type; /* invalid type in negative response */
738
739 dns_rdataset_t *opt; /* OPT rdataset */
740} respctx_t;
741
742static void
743rctx_respinit(isc_task_t *task, dns_dispatchevent_t *devent,
744 resquery_t *query, fetchctx_t *fctx, respctx_t *rctx);
745
746static void
747rctx_answer_init(respctx_t *rctx);
748
749static void
750rctx_answer_scan(respctx_t *rctx);
751
752static void
753rctx_authority_positive(respctx_t *rctx);
754
755static isc_result_t
756rctx_answer_any(respctx_t *rctx);
757
758static isc_result_t
759rctx_answer_match(respctx_t *rctx);
760
761static isc_result_t
762rctx_answer_cname(respctx_t *rctx);
763
764static isc_result_t
765rctx_answer_dname(respctx_t *rctx);
766
767static isc_result_t
768rctx_answer_positive(respctx_t *rctx);
769
770static isc_result_t
771rctx_authority_negative(respctx_t *rctx);
772
773static isc_result_t
774rctx_authority_dnssec(respctx_t *rctx);
775
776static void
777rctx_additional(respctx_t *rctx);
778
779static isc_result_t
780rctx_referral(respctx_t *rctx);
781
782static isc_result_t
783rctx_answer_none(respctx_t *rctx);
784
785static void
786rctx_nextserver(respctx_t *rctx, dns_adbaddrinfo_t *addrinfo,
787 isc_result_t result);
788
789static void
790rctx_resend(respctx_t *rctx, dns_adbaddrinfo_t *addrinfo);
791
792static void
793rctx_next(respctx_t *rctx);
794
795static void
796rctx_chaseds(respctx_t *rctx, dns_adbaddrinfo_t *addrinfo, isc_result_t result);
797
798static void
799rctx_done(respctx_t *rctx, isc_result_t result);
800
801static void
802rctx_logpacket(respctx_t *rctx);
803
804static void
805rctx_opt(respctx_t *rctx);
806
807static void
808rctx_edns(respctx_t *rctx);
809
810static isc_result_t
811rctx_parse(respctx_t *rctx);
812
813static isc_result_t
814rctx_badserver(respctx_t *rctx, isc_result_t result);
815
816static isc_result_t
817rctx_answer(respctx_t *rctx);
818
819static isc_result_t
820rctx_lameserver(respctx_t *rctx);
821
822static isc_result_t
823rctx_dispfail(respctx_t *rctx);
824
825static void
826rctx_delonly_zone(respctx_t *rctx);
827
828static void
829rctx_ncache(respctx_t *rctx);
830
831
832/*%
833 * Increment resolver-related statistics counters.
834 */
835static inline void
836inc_stats(dns_resolver_t *res, isc_statscounter_t counter) {
837 if (res->view->resstats != NULL)
838 isc_stats_increment(res->view->resstats, counter);
839}
840
841static inline void
842dec_stats(dns_resolver_t *res, isc_statscounter_t counter) {
843 if (res->view->resstats != NULL)
844 isc_stats_decrement(res->view->resstats, counter);
845}
846
847static isc_result_t
848valcreate(fetchctx_t *fctx, dns_adbaddrinfo_t *addrinfo, dns_name_t *name,
849 dns_rdatatype_t type, dns_rdataset_t *rdataset,
850 dns_rdataset_t *sigrdataset, unsigned int valoptions,
851 isc_task_t *task)
852{
853 dns_validator_t *validator = NULL;
854 dns_valarg_t *valarg;
855 isc_result_t result;
856
857 valarg = isc_mem_get(fctx->mctx, sizeof(*valarg));
858 if (valarg == NULL)
859 return (ISC_R_NOMEMORY);
860
861 valarg->fctx = fctx;
862 valarg->addrinfo = addrinfo;
863
864 if (!ISC_LIST_EMPTY(fctx->validators))
865 valoptions |= DNS_VALIDATOR_DEFER;
866 else
867 valoptions &= ~DNS_VALIDATOR_DEFER;
868
869 result = dns_validator_create(fctx->res->view, name, type, rdataset,
870 sigrdataset, fctx->rmessage,
871 valoptions, task, validated, valarg,
872 &validator);
873 if (result == ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
874 inc_stats(fctx->res, dns_resstatscounter_val);
875 if ((valoptions & DNS_VALIDATOR_DEFER) == 0) {
876 INSIST(fctx->validator == NULL);
877 fctx->validator = validator;
878 }
879 ISC_LIST_APPEND(fctx->validators, validator, link);
880 } else
881 isc_mem_put(fctx->mctx, valarg, sizeof(*valarg));
882 return (result);
883}
884
885static bool
886rrsig_fromchildzone(fetchctx_t *fctx, dns_rdataset_t *rdataset) {
887 dns_namereln_t namereln;
888 dns_rdata_rrsig_t rrsig;
889 dns_rdata_t rdata = DNS_RDATA_INIT;
890 int order;
891 isc_result_t result;
892 unsigned int labels;
893
894 for (result = dns_rdataset_first(rdataset);
895 result == ISC_R_SUCCESS;
896 result = dns_rdataset_next(rdataset)) {
897 dns_rdataset_current(rdataset, &rdata);
898 result = dns_rdata_tostruct(&rdata, &rrsig, NULL);
899 RUNTIME_CHECK(result == ISC_R_SUCCESS);
900 namereln = dns_name_fullcompare(&rrsig.signer, &fctx->domain,
901 &order, &labels);
902 if (namereln == dns_namereln_subdomain)
903 return (true);
904 dns_rdata_reset(&rdata);
905 }
906 return (false);
907}
908
909static bool
910fix_mustbedelegationornxdomain(dns_message_t *message, fetchctx_t *fctx) {
911 dns_name_t *name;
912 dns_name_t *domain = &fctx->domain;
913 dns_rdataset_t *rdataset;
914 dns_rdatatype_t type;
915 isc_result_t result;
916 bool keep_auth = false;
917
918 if (message->rcode == dns_rcode_nxdomain)
919 return (false);
920
921 /*
922 * A DS RRset can appear anywhere in a zone, even for a delegation-only
923 * zone. So a response to an explicit query for this type should be
924 * excluded from delegation-only fixup.
925 *
926 * SOA, NS, and DNSKEY can only exist at a zone apex, so a postive
927 * response to a query for these types can never violate the
928 * delegation-only assumption: if the query name is below a
929 * zone cut, the response should normally be a referral, which should
930 * be accepted; if the query name is below a zone cut but the server
931 * happens to have authority for the zone of the query name, the
932 * response is a (non-referral) answer. But this does not violate
933 * delegation-only because the query name must be in a different zone
934 * due to the "apex-only" nature of these types. Note that if the
935 * remote server happens to have authority for a child zone of a
936 * delegation-only zone, we may still incorrectly "fix" the response
937 * with NXDOMAIN for queries for other types. Unfortunately it's
938 * generally impossible to differentiate this case from violation of
939 * the delegation-only assumption. Once the resolver learns the
940 * correct zone cut, possibly via a separate query for an "apex-only"
941 * type, queries for other types will be resolved correctly.
942 *
943 * A query for type ANY will be accepted if it hits an exceptional
944 * type above in the answer section as it should be from a child
945 * zone.
946 *
947 * Also accept answers with RRSIG records from the child zone.
948 * Direct queries for RRSIG records should not be answered from
949 * the parent zone.
950 */
951
952 if (message->counts[DNS_SECTION_ANSWER] != 0 &&
953 (fctx->type == dns_rdatatype_ns ||
954 fctx->type == dns_rdatatype_ds ||
955 fctx->type == dns_rdatatype_soa ||
956 fctx->type == dns_rdatatype_any ||
957 fctx->type == dns_rdatatype_rrsig ||
958 fctx->type == dns_rdatatype_dnskey)) {
959 result = dns_message_firstname(message, DNS_SECTION_ANSWER);
960 while (result == ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
961 name = NULL;
962 dns_message_currentname(message, DNS_SECTION_ANSWER,
963 &name);
964 for (rdataset = ISC_LIST_HEAD(name->list);
965 rdataset != NULL;
966 rdataset = ISC_LIST_NEXT(rdataset, link)) {
967 if (!dns_name_equal(name, &fctx->name))
968 continue;
969 type = rdataset->type;
970 /*
971 * RRsig from child?
972 */
973 if (type == dns_rdatatype_rrsig &&
974 rrsig_fromchildzone(fctx, rdataset))
975 return (false);
976 /*
977 * Direct query for apex records or DS.
978 */
979 if (fctx->type == type &&
980 (type == dns_rdatatype_ds ||
981 type == dns_rdatatype_ns ||
982 type == dns_rdatatype_soa ||
983 type == dns_rdatatype_dnskey))
984 return (false);
985 /*
986 * Indirect query for apex records or DS.
987 */
988 if (fctx->type == dns_rdatatype_any &&
989 (type == dns_rdatatype_ns ||
990 type == dns_rdatatype_ds ||
991 type == dns_rdatatype_soa ||
992 type == dns_rdatatype_dnskey))
993 return (false);
994 }
995 result = dns_message_nextname(message,
996 DNS_SECTION_ANSWER);
997 }
998 }
999
1000 /*
1001 * A NODATA response to a DS query?
1002 */
1003 if (fctx->type == dns_rdatatype_ds &&
1004 message->counts[DNS_SECTION_ANSWER] == 0)
1005 return (false);
1006
1007 /* Look for referral or indication of answer from child zone? */
1008 if (message->counts[DNS_SECTION_AUTHORITY] == 0)
1009 goto munge;
1010
1011 result = dns_message_firstname(message, DNS_SECTION_AUTHORITY);
1012 while (result == ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
1013 name = NULL;
1014 dns_message_currentname(message, DNS_SECTION_AUTHORITY, &name);
1015 for (rdataset = ISC_LIST_HEAD(name->list);
1016 rdataset != NULL;
1017 rdataset = ISC_LIST_NEXT(rdataset, link)) {
1018 type = rdataset->type;
1019 if (type == dns_rdatatype_soa &&
1020 dns_name_equal(name, domain))
1021 keep_auth = true;
1022
1023 if (type != dns_rdatatype_ns &&
1024 type != dns_rdatatype_soa &&
1025 type != dns_rdatatype_rrsig)
1026 continue;
1027
1028 if (type == dns_rdatatype_rrsig) {
1029 if (rrsig_fromchildzone(fctx, rdataset))
1030 return (false);
1031 else
1032 continue;
1033 }
1034
1035 /* NS or SOA records. */
1036 if (dns_name_equal(name, domain)) {
1037 /*
1038 * If a query for ANY causes a negative
1039 * response, we can be sure that this is
1040 * an empty node. For other type of queries
1041 * we cannot differentiate an empty node
1042 * from a node that just doesn't have that
1043 * type of record. We only accept the former
1044 * case.
1045 */
1046 if (message->counts[DNS_SECTION_ANSWER] == 0 &&
1047 fctx->type == dns_rdatatype_any)
1048 return (false);
1049 } else if (dns_name_issubdomain(name, domain)) {
1050 /* Referral or answer from child zone. */
1051 return (false);
1052 }
1053 }
1054 result = dns_message_nextname(message, DNS_SECTION_AUTHORITY);
1055 }
1056
1057 munge:
1058 message->rcode = dns_rcode_nxdomain;
1059 message->counts[DNS_SECTION_ANSWER] = 0;
1060 if (!keep_auth)
1061 message->counts[DNS_SECTION_AUTHORITY] = 0;
1062 message->counts[DNS_SECTION_ADDITIONAL] = 0;
1063 return (true);
1064}
1065
1066static inline isc_result_t
1067fctx_starttimer(fetchctx_t *fctx) {
1068 /*
1069 * Start the lifetime timer for fctx.
1070 *
1071 * This is also used for stopping the idle timer; in that
1072 * case we must purge events already posted to ensure that
1073 * no further idle events are delivered.
1074 */
1075 return (isc_timer_reset(fctx->timer, isc_timertype_once,
1076 &fctx->expires, NULL, true));
1077}
1078
1079static inline void
1080fctx_stoptimer(fetchctx_t *fctx) {
1081 isc_result_t result;
1082
1083 /*
1084 * We don't return a result if resetting the timer to inactive fails
1085 * since there's nothing to be done about it. Resetting to inactive
1086 * should never fail anyway, since the code as currently written
1087 * cannot fail in that case.
1088 */
1089 result = isc_timer_reset(fctx->timer, isc_timertype_inactive,
1090 NULL, NULL, true);
1091 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
1092 UNEXPECTED_ERROR(__FILE__, __LINE__,
1093 "isc_timer_reset(): %s",
1094 isc_result_totext(result));
1095 }
1096}
1097
1098static inline isc_result_t
1099fctx_startidletimer(fetchctx_t *fctx, isc_interval_t *interval) {
1100 /*
1101 * Start the idle timer for fctx. The lifetime timer continues
1102 * to be in effect.
1103 */
1104 return (isc_timer_reset(fctx->timer, isc_timertype_once,
1105 &fctx->expires, interval, false));
1106}
1107
1108/*
1109 * Stopping the idle timer is equivalent to calling fctx_starttimer(), but
1110 * we use fctx_stopidletimer for readability in the code below.
1111 */
1112#define fctx_stopidletimer fctx_starttimer
1113
1114static inline void
1115resquery_destroy(resquery_t **queryp) {
1116 dns_resolver_t *res;
1117 bool empty;
1118 resquery_t *query;
1119 fetchctx_t *fctx;
1120 unsigned int bucket;
1121
1122 REQUIRE(queryp != NULL);
1123 query = *queryp;
1124 REQUIRE(!ISC_LINK_LINKED(query, link));
1125
1126 INSIST(query->tcpsocket == NULL);
1127
1128 fctx = query->fctx;
1129 res = fctx->res;
1130 bucket = fctx->bucketnum;
1131
1132 fctx->nqueries--;
1133
1134 LOCK(&res->buckets[bucket].lock);
1135 empty = fctx_decreference(query->fctx);
1136 UNLOCK(&res->buckets[bucket].lock);
1137
1138 query->magic = 0;
1139 isc_mem_put(query->mctx, query, sizeof(*query));
1140 *queryp = NULL;
1141
1142 if (empty)
1143 empty_bucket(res);
1144}
1145
1146static void
1147fctx_cancelquery(resquery_t **queryp, dns_dispatchevent_t **deventp,
1148 isc_time_t *finish, bool no_response,
1149 bool age_untried)
1150{
1151 fetchctx_t *fctx;
1152 resquery_t *query;
1153 unsigned int rtt, rttms;
1154 unsigned int factor;
1155 dns_adbfind_t *find;
1156 dns_adbaddrinfo_t *addrinfo;
1157 isc_socket_t *sock;
1158 isc_stdtime_t now;
1159
1160 query = *queryp;
1161 fctx = query->fctx;
1162
1163 FCTXTRACE("cancelquery");
1164
1165 REQUIRE(!RESQUERY_CANCELED(query));
1166
1167 query->attributes |= RESQUERY_ATTR_CANCELED;
1168
1169 /*
1170 * Should we update the RTT?
1171 */
1172 if (finish != NULL || no_response) {
1173 if (finish != NULL) {
1174 /*
1175 * We have both the start and finish times for this
1176 * packet, so we can compute a real RTT.
1177 */
1178 rtt = (unsigned int)isc_time_microdiff(finish,
1179 &query->start);
1180 factor = DNS_ADB_RTTADJDEFAULT;
1181
1182 rttms = rtt / 1000;
1183 if (rttms < DNS_RESOLVER_QRYRTTCLASS0) {
1184 inc_stats(fctx->res,
1185 dns_resstatscounter_queryrtt0);
1186 } else if (rttms < DNS_RESOLVER_QRYRTTCLASS1) {
1187 inc_stats(fctx->res,
1188 dns_resstatscounter_queryrtt1);
1189 } else if (rttms < DNS_RESOLVER_QRYRTTCLASS2) {
1190 inc_stats(fctx->res,
1191 dns_resstatscounter_queryrtt2);
1192 } else if (rttms < DNS_RESOLVER_QRYRTTCLASS3) {
1193 inc_stats(fctx->res,
1194 dns_resstatscounter_queryrtt3);
1195 } else if (rttms < DNS_RESOLVER_QRYRTTCLASS4) {
1196 inc_stats(fctx->res,
1197 dns_resstatscounter_queryrtt4);
1198 } else {
1199 inc_stats(fctx->res,
1200 dns_resstatscounter_queryrtt5);
1201 }
1202 } else {
1203 uint32_t value;
1204 uint32_t mask;
1205
1206 if ((query->options & DNS_FETCHOPT_NOEDNS0) == 0)
1207 dns_adb_ednsto(fctx->adb, query->addrinfo,
1208 query->udpsize);
1209 else
1210 dns_adb_timeout(fctx->adb, query->addrinfo);
1211
1212 /*
1213 * If "forward first;" is used and a forwarder timed
1214 * out, do not attempt to query it again in this fetch
1215 * context.
1216 */
1217 if (fctx->fwdpolicy == dns_fwdpolicy_first &&
1218 ISFORWARDER(query->addrinfo))
1219 {
1220 add_bad(fctx, query->addrinfo, ISC_R_TIMEDOUT,
1221 badns_forwarder);
1222 }
1223
1224 /*
1225 * We don't have an RTT for this query. Maybe the
1226 * packet was lost, or maybe this server is very
1227 * slow. We don't know. Increase the RTT.
1228 */
1229 INSIST(no_response);
1230 value = isc_random32();
1231 if (query->addrinfo->srtt > 800000)
1232 mask = 0x3fff;
1233 else if (query->addrinfo->srtt > 400000)
1234 mask = 0x7fff;
1235 else if (query->addrinfo->srtt > 200000)
1236 mask = 0xffff;
1237 else if (query->addrinfo->srtt > 100000)
1238 mask = 0x1ffff;
1239 else if (query->addrinfo->srtt > 50000)
1240 mask = 0x3ffff;
1241 else if (query->addrinfo->srtt > 25000)
1242 mask = 0x7ffff;
1243 else
1244 mask = 0xfffff;
1245
1246 /*
1247 * Don't adjust timeout on EDNS queries unless we have
1248 * seen a EDNS response.
1249 */
1250 if ((query->options & DNS_FETCHOPT_NOEDNS0) == 0 &&
1251 !EDNSOK(query->addrinfo)) {
1252 mask >>= 2;
1253 }
1254
1255 rtt = query->addrinfo->srtt + (value & mask);
1256 if (rtt > MAX_SINGLE_QUERY_TIMEOUT_US)
1257 rtt = MAX_SINGLE_QUERY_TIMEOUT_US;
1258
1259 /*
1260 * Replace the current RTT with our value.
1261 */
1262 factor = DNS_ADB_RTTADJREPLACE;
1263 }
1264
1265 dns_adb_adjustsrtt(fctx->adb, query->addrinfo, rtt, factor);
1266 }
1267 dns_adb_endudpfetch(fctx->adb, query->addrinfo);
1268
1269 /*
1270 * Age RTTs of servers not tried.
1271 */
1272 isc_stdtime_get(&now);
1273 if (finish != NULL || age_untried)
1274 for (addrinfo = ISC_LIST_HEAD(fctx->forwaddrs);
1275 addrinfo != NULL;
1276 addrinfo = ISC_LIST_NEXT(addrinfo, publink))
1277 if (UNMARKED(addrinfo))
1278 dns_adb_agesrtt(fctx->adb, addrinfo, now);
1279
1280 if ((finish != NULL || age_untried) && TRIEDFIND(fctx))
1281 for (find = ISC_LIST_HEAD(fctx->finds);
1282 find != NULL;
1283 find = ISC_LIST_NEXT(find, publink))
1284 for (addrinfo = ISC_LIST_HEAD(find->list);
1285 addrinfo != NULL;
1286 addrinfo = ISC_LIST_NEXT(addrinfo, publink))
1287 if (UNMARKED(addrinfo))
1288 dns_adb_agesrtt(fctx->adb, addrinfo,
1289 now);
1290
1291 if ((finish != NULL || age_untried) && TRIEDALT(fctx)) {
1292 for (addrinfo = ISC_LIST_HEAD(fctx->altaddrs);
1293 addrinfo != NULL;
1294 addrinfo = ISC_LIST_NEXT(addrinfo, publink))
1295 if (UNMARKED(addrinfo))
1296 dns_adb_agesrtt(fctx->adb, addrinfo, now);
1297 for (find = ISC_LIST_HEAD(fctx->altfinds);
1298 find != NULL;
1299 find = ISC_LIST_NEXT(find, publink))
1300 for (addrinfo = ISC_LIST_HEAD(find->list);
1301 addrinfo != NULL;
1302 addrinfo = ISC_LIST_NEXT(addrinfo, publink))
1303 if (UNMARKED(addrinfo))
1304 dns_adb_agesrtt(fctx->adb, addrinfo,
1305 now);
1306 }
1307
1308 /*
1309 * Check for any outstanding socket events. If they exist, cancel
1310 * them and let the event handlers finish the cleanup. The resolver
1311 * only needs to worry about managing the connect and send events;
1312 * the dispatcher manages the recv events.
1313 */
1314 if (RESQUERY_CONNECTING(query)) {
1315 /*
1316 * Cancel the connect.
1317 */
1318 if (query->tcpsocket != NULL) {
1319 isc_socket_cancel(query->tcpsocket, NULL,
1320 ISC_SOCKCANCEL_CONNECT);
1321 } else if (query->dispentry != NULL) {
1322 INSIST(query->exclusivesocket);
1323 sock = dns_dispatch_getentrysocket(query->dispentry);
1324 if (sock != NULL)
1325 isc_socket_cancel(sock, NULL,
1326 ISC_SOCKCANCEL_CONNECT);
1327 }
1328 }
1329 if (RESQUERY_SENDING(query)) {
1330 /*
1331 * Cancel the pending send.
1332 */
1333 if (query->exclusivesocket && query->dispentry != NULL)
1334 sock = dns_dispatch_getentrysocket(query->dispentry);
1335 else
1336 sock = dns_dispatch_getsocket(query->dispatch);
1337 if (sock != NULL)
1338 isc_socket_cancel(sock, NULL, ISC_SOCKCANCEL_SEND);
1339 }
1340
1341 if (query->dispentry != NULL)
1342 dns_dispatch_removeresponse(&query->dispentry, deventp);
1343
1344 ISC_LIST_UNLINK(fctx->queries, query, link);
1345
1346 if (query->tsig != NULL)
1347 isc_buffer_free(&query->tsig);
1348
1349 if (query->tsigkey != NULL)
1350 dns_tsigkey_detach(&query->tsigkey);
1351
1352 if (query->dispatch != NULL)
1353 dns_dispatch_detach(&query->dispatch);
1354
1355 if (! (RESQUERY_CONNECTING(query) || RESQUERY_SENDING(query)))
1356 /*
1357 * It's safe to destroy the query now.
1358 */
1359 resquery_destroy(&query);
1360}
1361
1362static void
1363fctx_cancelqueries(fetchctx_t *fctx, bool no_response,
1364 bool age_untried)
1365{
1366 resquery_t *query, *next_query;
1367
1368 FCTXTRACE("cancelqueries");
1369
1370 for (query = ISC_LIST_HEAD(fctx->queries);
1371 query != NULL;
1372 query = next_query) {
1373 next_query = ISC_LIST_NEXT(query, link);
1374 fctx_cancelquery(&query, NULL, NULL, no_response,
1375 age_untried);
1376 }
1377}
1378
1379static void
1380fctx_cleanupfinds(fetchctx_t *fctx) {
1381 dns_adbfind_t *find, *next_find;
1382
1383 REQUIRE(ISC_LIST_EMPTY(fctx->queries));
1384
1385 for (find = ISC_LIST_HEAD(fctx->finds);
1386 find != NULL;
1387 find = next_find)
1388 {
1389 next_find = ISC_LIST_NEXT(find, publink);
1390 ISC_LIST_UNLINK(fctx->finds, find, publink);
1391 dns_adb_destroyfind(&find);
1392 }
1393 fctx->find = NULL;
1394}
1395
1396static void
1397fctx_cleanupaltfinds(fetchctx_t *fctx) {
1398 dns_adbfind_t *find, *next_find;
1399
1400 REQUIRE(ISC_LIST_EMPTY(fctx->queries));
1401
1402 for (find = ISC_LIST_HEAD(fctx->altfinds);
1403 find != NULL;
1404 find = next_find)
1405 {
1406 next_find = ISC_LIST_NEXT(find, publink);
1407 ISC_LIST_UNLINK(fctx->altfinds, find, publink);
1408 dns_adb_destroyfind(&find);
1409 }
1410 fctx->altfind = NULL;
1411}
1412
1413static void
1414fctx_cleanupforwaddrs(fetchctx_t *fctx) {
1415 dns_adbaddrinfo_t *addr, *next_addr;
1416
1417 REQUIRE(ISC_LIST_EMPTY(fctx->queries));
1418
1419 for (addr = ISC_LIST_HEAD(fctx->forwaddrs);
1420 addr != NULL;
1421 addr = next_addr)
1422 {
1423 next_addr = ISC_LIST_NEXT(addr, publink);
1424 ISC_LIST_UNLINK(fctx->forwaddrs, addr, publink);
1425 dns_adb_freeaddrinfo(fctx->adb, &addr);
1426 }
1427}
1428
1429static void
1430fctx_cleanupaltaddrs(fetchctx_t *fctx) {
1431 dns_adbaddrinfo_t *addr, *next_addr;
1432
1433 REQUIRE(ISC_LIST_EMPTY(fctx->queries));
1434
1435 for (addr = ISC_LIST_HEAD(fctx->altaddrs);
1436 addr != NULL;
1437 addr = next_addr)
1438 {
1439 next_addr = ISC_LIST_NEXT(addr, publink);
1440 ISC_LIST_UNLINK(fctx->altaddrs, addr, publink);
1441 dns_adb_freeaddrinfo(fctx->adb, &addr);
1442 }
1443}
1444
1445static inline void
1446fctx_stopqueries(fetchctx_t *fctx, bool no_response,
1447 bool age_untried)
1448{
1449 FCTXTRACE("stopqueries");
1450 fctx_cancelqueries(fctx, no_response, age_untried);
1451 fctx_stoptimer(fctx);
1452}
1453
1454static inline void
1455fctx_cleanupall(fetchctx_t *fctx) {
1456 fctx_cleanupfinds(fctx);
1457 fctx_cleanupaltfinds(fctx);
1458 fctx_cleanupforwaddrs(fctx);
1459 fctx_cleanupaltaddrs(fctx);
1460}
1461
1462static void
1463fcount_logspill(fetchctx_t *fctx, fctxcount_t *counter) {
1464 char dbuf[DNS_NAME_FORMATSIZE];
1465 isc_stdtime_t now;
1466
1467 if (! isc_log_wouldlog(dns_lctx, ISC_LOG_INFO))
1468 return;
1469
1470 isc_stdtime_get(&now);
1471 if (counter->logged > now - 60)
1472 return;
1473
1474 dns_name_format(&fctx->domain, dbuf, sizeof(dbuf));
1475
1476 isc_log_write(dns_lctx, DNS_LOGCATEGORY_SPILL,
1477 DNS_LOGMODULE_RESOLVER, ISC_LOG_INFO,
1478 "too many simultaneous fetches for %s "
1479 "(allowed %d spilled %d)",
1480 dbuf, counter->allowed, counter->dropped);
1481
1482 counter->logged = now;
1483}
1484
1485static isc_result_t
1486fcount_incr(fetchctx_t *fctx, bool force) {
1487 isc_result_t result = ISC_R_SUCCESS;
1488 zonebucket_t *dbucket;
1489 fctxcount_t *counter;
1490 unsigned int bucketnum, spill;
1491
1492 REQUIRE(fctx != NULL);
1493 REQUIRE(fctx->res != NULL);
1494
1495 INSIST(fctx->dbucketnum == RES_NOBUCKET);
1496 bucketnum = dns_name_fullhash(&fctx->domain, false)
1497 % RES_DOMAIN_BUCKETS;
1498
1499 LOCK(&fctx->res->lock);
1500 spill = fctx->res->zspill;
1501 UNLOCK(&fctx->res->lock);
1502
1503 dbucket = &fctx->res->dbuckets[bucketnum];
1504
1505 LOCK(&dbucket->lock);
1506 for (counter = ISC_LIST_HEAD(dbucket->list);
1507 counter != NULL;
1508 counter = ISC_LIST_NEXT(counter, link))
1509 {
1510 if (dns_name_equal(counter->domain, &fctx->domain))
1511 break;
1512 }
1513
1514 if (counter == NULL) {
1515 counter = isc_mem_get(dbucket->mctx, sizeof(fctxcount_t));
1516 if (counter == NULL)
1517 result = ISC_R_NOMEMORY;
1518 else {
1519 ISC_LINK_INIT(counter, link);
1520 counter->count = 1;
1521 counter->logged = 0;
1522 counter->allowed = 1;
1523 counter->dropped = 0;
1524 counter->domain =
1525 dns_fixedname_initname(&counter->fdname);
1526 dns_name_copy(&fctx->domain, counter->domain, NULL);
1527 ISC_LIST_APPEND(dbucket->list, counter, link);
1528 }
1529 } else {
1530 if (!force && spill != 0 && counter->count >= spill) {
1531 counter->dropped++;
1532 fcount_logspill(fctx, counter);
1533 result = ISC_R_QUOTA;
1534 } else {
1535 counter->count++;
1536 counter->allowed++;
1537 }
1538 }
1539 UNLOCK(&dbucket->lock);
1540
1541 if (result == ISC_R_SUCCESS)
1542 fctx->dbucketnum = bucketnum;
1543
1544 return (result);
1545}
1546
1547static void
1548fcount_decr(fetchctx_t *fctx) {
1549 zonebucket_t *dbucket;
1550 fctxcount_t *counter;
1551
1552 REQUIRE(fctx != NULL);
1553
1554 if (fctx->dbucketnum == RES_NOBUCKET)
1555 return;
1556
1557 dbucket = &fctx->res->dbuckets[fctx->dbucketnum];
1558
1559 LOCK(&dbucket->lock);
1560 for (counter = ISC_LIST_HEAD(dbucket->list);
1561 counter != NULL;
1562 counter = ISC_LIST_NEXT(counter, link))
1563 {
1564 if (dns_name_equal(counter->domain, &fctx->domain))
1565 break;
1566 }
1567
1568 if (counter != NULL) {
1569 INSIST(counter->count != 0);
1570 counter->count--;
1571 fctx->dbucketnum = RES_NOBUCKET;
1572
1573 if (counter->count == 0) {
1574 ISC_LIST_UNLINK(dbucket->list, counter, link);
1575 isc_mem_put(dbucket->mctx, counter, sizeof(*counter));
1576 }
1577 }
1578
1579 UNLOCK(&dbucket->lock);
1580}
1581
1582static inline void
1583fctx_sendevents(fetchctx_t *fctx, isc_result_t result, int line) {
1584 dns_fetchevent_t *event, *next_event;
1585 isc_task_t *task;
1586 unsigned int count = 0;
1587 isc_interval_t i;
1588 bool logit = false;
1589 isc_time_t now;
1590 unsigned int old_spillat;
1591 unsigned int new_spillat = 0; /* initialized to silence
1592 compiler warnings */
1593
1594 /*
1595 * Caller must be holding the appropriate bucket lock.
1596 */
1597 REQUIRE(fctx->state == fetchstate_done);
1598
1599 FCTXTRACE("sendevents");
1600
1601 /*
1602 * Keep some record of fetch result for logging later (if required).
1603 */
1604 fctx->result = result;
1605 fctx->exitline = line;
1606 TIME_NOW(&now);
1607 fctx->duration = isc_time_microdiff(&now, &fctx->start);
1608
1609 for (event = ISC_LIST_HEAD(fctx->events);
1610 event != NULL;
1611 event = next_event) {
1612 next_event = ISC_LIST_NEXT(event, ev_link);
1613 ISC_LIST_UNLINK(fctx->events, event, ev_link);
1614 task = event->ev_sender;
1615 event->ev_sender = fctx;
1616 event->vresult = fctx->vresult;
1617 if (!HAVE_ANSWER(fctx))
1618 event->result = result;
1619
1620 INSIST(event->result != ISC_R_SUCCESS ||
1621 dns_rdataset_isassociated(event->rdataset) ||
1622 fctx->type == dns_rdatatype_any ||
1623 fctx->type == dns_rdatatype_rrsig ||
1624 fctx->type == dns_rdatatype_sig);
1625
1626 /*
1627 * Negative results must be indicated in event->result.
1628 */
1629 if (dns_rdataset_isassociated(event->rdataset) &&
1630 NEGATIVE(event->rdataset)) {
1631 INSIST(event->result == DNS_R_NCACHENXDOMAIN ||
1632 event->result == DNS_R_NCACHENXRRSET);
1633 }
1634
1635 isc_task_sendanddetach(&task, ISC_EVENT_PTR(&event));
1636 count++;
1637 }
1638
1639 if ((fctx->attributes & FCTX_ATTR_HAVEANSWER) != 0 &&
1640 fctx->spilled &&
1641 (count < fctx->res->spillatmax || fctx->res->spillatmax == 0)) {
1642 LOCK(&fctx->res->lock);
1643 if (count == fctx->res->spillat && !fctx->res->exiting) {
1644 old_spillat = fctx->res->spillat;
1645 fctx->res->spillat += 5;
1646 if (fctx->res->spillat > fctx->res->spillatmax &&
1647 fctx->res->spillatmax != 0)
1648 fctx->res->spillat = fctx->res->spillatmax;
1649 new_spillat = fctx->res->spillat;
1650 if (new_spillat != old_spillat) {
1651 logit = true;
1652 }
1653 isc_interval_set(&i, 20 * 60, 0);
1654 result = isc_timer_reset(fctx->res->spillattimer,
1655 isc_timertype_ticker, NULL,
1656 &i, true);
1657 RUNTIME_CHECK(result == ISC_R_SUCCESS);
1658 }
1659 UNLOCK(&fctx->res->lock);
1660 if (logit)
1661 isc_log_write(dns_lctx, DNS_LOGCATEGORY_RESOLVER,
1662 DNS_LOGMODULE_RESOLVER, ISC_LOG_NOTICE,
1663 "clients-per-query increased to %u",
1664 new_spillat);
1665 }
1666}
1667
1668static inline void
1669log_edns(fetchctx_t *fctx) {
1670 char domainbuf[DNS_NAME_FORMATSIZE];
1671
1672 if (fctx->reason == NULL)
1673 return;
1674
1675 /*
1676 * We do not know if fctx->domain is the actual domain the record
1677 * lives in or a parent domain so we have a '?' after it.
1678 */
1679 dns_name_format(&fctx->domain, domainbuf, sizeof(domainbuf));
1680 isc_log_write(dns_lctx, DNS_LOGCATEGORY_EDNS_DISABLED,
1681 DNS_LOGMODULE_RESOLVER, ISC_LOG_INFO,
1682 "success resolving '%s' (in '%s'?) after %s",
1683 fctx->info, domainbuf, fctx->reason);
1684}
1685
1686static void
1687fctx_done(fetchctx_t *fctx, isc_result_t result, int line) {
1688 dns_resolver_t *res;
1689 bool no_response = false;
1690 bool age_untried = false;
1691
1692 REQUIRE(line >= 0);
1693
1694 FCTXTRACE("done");
1695
1696 res = fctx->res;
1697
1698 if (result == ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
1699 /*%
1700 * Log any deferred EDNS timeout messages.
1701 */
1702 log_edns(fctx);
1703 no_response = true;
1704 if (fctx->qmin_warning != ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
1705 isc_log_write(dns_lctx, DNS_LOGCATEGORY_LAME_SERVERS,
1706 DNS_LOGMODULE_RESOLVER, ISC_LOG_INFO,
1707 "success resolving '%s' "
1708 "after disabling qname minimization due to '%s'",
1709 fctx->info,
1710 isc_result_totext(fctx->qmin_warning));
1711 }
1712 } else if (result == ISC_R_TIMEDOUT) {
1713 age_untried = true;
1714 }
1715
1716 fctx->qmin_warning = ISC_R_SUCCESS;
1717 fctx->reason = NULL;
1718
1719 fctx_stopqueries(fctx, no_response, age_untried);
1720
1721 LOCK(&res->buckets[fctx->bucketnum].lock);
1722
1723 fctx->state = fetchstate_done;
1724 fctx->attributes &= ~FCTX_ATTR_ADDRWAIT;
1725 fctx_sendevents(fctx, result, line);
1726
1727 UNLOCK(&res->buckets[fctx->bucketnum].lock);
1728}
1729
1730static void
1731process_sendevent(resquery_t *query, isc_event_t *event) {
1732 isc_socketevent_t *sevent = (isc_socketevent_t *)event;
1733 bool destroy_query = false;
1734 bool retry = false;
1735 isc_result_t result;
1736 fetchctx_t *fctx;
1737
1738 fctx = query->fctx;
1739
1740 if (RESQUERY_CANCELED(query)) {
1741 if (query->sends == 0 && query->connects == 0) {
1742 /*
1743 * This query was canceled while the
1744 * isc_socket_sendto/connect() was in progress.
1745 */
1746 if (query->tcpsocket != NULL)
1747 isc_socket_detach(&query->tcpsocket);
1748 destroy_query = true;
1749 }
1750 } else {
1751 switch (sevent->result) {
1752 case ISC_R_SUCCESS:
1753 break;
1754
1755 case ISC_R_HOSTUNREACH:
1756 case ISC_R_NETUNREACH:
1757 case ISC_R_NOPERM:
1758 case ISC_R_ADDRNOTAVAIL:
1759 case ISC_R_CONNREFUSED:
1760 FCTXTRACE3("query canceled in sendevent(): "
1761 "no route to host; no response",
1762 sevent->result);
1763
1764 /*
1765 * No route to remote.
1766 */
1767 add_bad(fctx, query->addrinfo, sevent->result,
1768 badns_unreachable);
1769 fctx_cancelquery(&query, NULL, NULL, true,
1770 false);
1771 retry = true;
1772 break;
1773
1774 default:
1775 FCTXTRACE3("query canceled in sendevent() due to "
1776 "unexpected event result; responding",
1777 sevent->result);
1778
1779 fctx_cancelquery(&query, NULL, NULL, false,
1780 false);
1781 break;
1782 }
1783 }
1784
1785 if (event->ev_type == ISC_SOCKEVENT_CONNECT)
1786 isc_event_free(&event);
1787
1788 if (retry) {
1789 /*
1790 * Behave as if the idle timer has expired. For TCP
1791 * this may not actually reflect the latest timer.
1792 */
1793 fctx->attributes &= ~FCTX_ATTR_ADDRWAIT;
1794 result = fctx_stopidletimer(fctx);
1795 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
1796 fctx_done(fctx, result, __LINE__);
1797 else
1798 fctx_try(fctx, true, false);
1799 }
1800
1801 if (destroy_query)
1802 resquery_destroy(&query);
1803}
1804
1805static void
1806resquery_udpconnected(isc_task_t *task, isc_event_t *event) {
1807 resquery_t *query = event->ev_arg;
1808
1809 REQUIRE(event->ev_type == ISC_SOCKEVENT_CONNECT);
1810
1811 QTRACE("udpconnected");
1812
1813 UNUSED(task);
1814
1815 INSIST(RESQUERY_CONNECTING(query));
1816
1817 query->connects--;
1818
1819 process_sendevent(query, event);
1820}
1821
1822static void
1823resquery_senddone(isc_task_t *task, isc_event_t *event) {
1824 resquery_t *query = event->ev_arg;
1825
1826 REQUIRE(event->ev_type == ISC_SOCKEVENT_SENDDONE);
1827
1828 QTRACE("senddone");
1829
1830 /*
1831 * XXXRTH
1832 *
1833 * Currently we don't wait for the senddone event before retrying
1834 * a query. This means that if we get really behind, we may end
1835 * up doing extra work!
1836 */
1837
1838 UNUSED(task);
1839
1840 INSIST(RESQUERY_SENDING(query));
1841
1842 query->sends--;
1843
1844 process_sendevent(query, event);
1845}
1846
1847static inline isc_result_t
1848fctx_addopt(dns_message_t *message, unsigned int version,
1849 uint16_t udpsize, dns_ednsopt_t *ednsopts, size_t count)
1850{
1851 dns_rdataset_t *rdataset = NULL;
1852 isc_result_t result;
1853
1854 result = dns_message_buildopt(message, &rdataset, version, udpsize,
1855 DNS_MESSAGEEXTFLAG_DO, ednsopts, count);
1856 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
1857 return (result);
1858 return (dns_message_setopt(message, rdataset));
1859}
1860
1861static inline void
1862fctx_setretryinterval(fetchctx_t *fctx, unsigned int rtt) {
1863 unsigned int seconds;
1864 unsigned int us;
1865
1866 us = fctx->res->retryinterval * 1000;
1867 /*
1868 * Exponential backoff after the first few tries.
1869 */
1870 if (fctx->restarts > fctx->res->nonbackofftries) {
1871 int shift = fctx->restarts - fctx->res->nonbackofftries;
1872 if (shift > 6)
1873 shift = 6;
1874 us <<= shift;
1875 }
1876
1877 /*
1878 * Add a fudge factor to the expected rtt based on the current
1879 * estimate.
1880 */
1881 if (rtt < 50000)
1882 rtt += 50000;
1883 else if (rtt < 100000)
1884 rtt += 100000;
1885 else
1886 rtt += 200000;
1887
1888 /*
1889 * Always wait for at least the expected rtt.
1890 */
1891 if (us < rtt)
1892 us = rtt;
1893
1894 /*
1895 * But don't ever wait for more than 10 seconds.
1896 */
1897 if (us > MAX_SINGLE_QUERY_TIMEOUT_US)
1898 us = MAX_SINGLE_QUERY_TIMEOUT_US;
1899
1900 seconds = us / US_PER_SEC;
1901 us -= seconds * US_PER_SEC;
1902 isc_interval_set(&fctx->interval, seconds, us * 1000);
1903}
1904
1905static isc_result_t
1906fctx_query(fetchctx_t *fctx, dns_adbaddrinfo_t *addrinfo,
1907 unsigned int options)
1908{
1909 dns_resolver_t *res;
1910 isc_task_t *task;
1911 isc_result_t result;
1912 resquery_t *query;
1913 isc_sockaddr_t addr;
1914 bool have_addr = false;
1915 unsigned int srtt;
1916 isc_dscp_t dscp = -1;
1917
1918 FCTXTRACE("query");
1919
1920 res = fctx->res;
1921 task = res->buckets[fctx->bucketnum].task;
1922
1923 srtt = addrinfo->srtt;
1924
1925 /*
1926 * Allow an additional second for the kernel to resend the SYN (or
1927 * SYN without ECN in the case of stupid firewalls blocking ECN
1928 * negotiation) over the current RTT estimate.
1929 */
1930 if ((options & DNS_FETCHOPT_TCP) != 0) {
1931 srtt += 1000000;
1932 }
1933
1934 /*
1935 * A forwarder needs to make multiple queries. Give it at least
1936 * a second to do these in.
1937 */
1938 if (ISFORWARDER(addrinfo) && srtt < 1000000)
1939 srtt = 1000000;
1940
1941 fctx_setretryinterval(fctx, srtt);
1942 result = fctx_startidletimer(fctx, &fctx->interval);
1943 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
1944 return (result);
1945
1946 INSIST(ISC_LIST_EMPTY(fctx->validators));
1947
1948 dns_message_reset(fctx->rmessage, DNS_MESSAGE_INTENTPARSE);
1949
1950 query = isc_mem_get(fctx->mctx, sizeof(*query));
1951 if (query == NULL) {
1952 result = ISC_R_NOMEMORY;
1953 goto stop_idle_timer;
1954 }
1955 query->mctx = fctx->mctx;
1956 query->options = options;
1957 query->attributes = 0;
1958 query->sends = 0;
1959 query->connects = 0;
1960 query->dscp = addrinfo->dscp;
1961 query->udpsize = 0;
1962 /*
1963 * Note that the caller MUST guarantee that 'addrinfo' will remain
1964 * valid until this query is canceled.
1965 */
1966 query->addrinfo = addrinfo;
1967 TIME_NOW(&query->start);
1968
1969 /*
1970 * If this is a TCP query, then we need to make a socket and
1971 * a dispatch for it here. Otherwise we use the resolver's
1972 * shared dispatch.
1973 */
1974 query->dispatchmgr = res->dispatchmgr;
1975 query->dispatch = NULL;
1976 query->exclusivesocket = false;
1977 query->tcpsocket = NULL;
1978 if (res->view->peers != NULL) {
1979 dns_peer_t *peer = NULL;
1980 isc_netaddr_t dstip;
1981 bool usetcp = false;
1982 isc_netaddr_fromsockaddr(&dstip, &addrinfo->sockaddr);
1983 result = dns_peerlist_peerbyaddr(res->view->peers,
1984 &dstip, &peer);
1985 if (result == ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
1986 result = dns_peer_getquerysource(peer, &addr);
1987 if (result == ISC_R_SUCCESS)
1988 have_addr = true;
1989 result = dns_peer_getquerydscp(peer, &dscp);
1990 if (result == ISC_R_SUCCESS)
1991 query->dscp = dscp;
1992 result = dns_peer_getforcetcp(peer, &usetcp);
1993 if (result == ISC_R_SUCCESS && usetcp)
1994 query->options |= DNS_FETCHOPT_TCP;
1995 }
1996 }
1997
1998 dscp = -1;
1999 if ((query->options & DNS_FETCHOPT_TCP) != 0) {
2000 int pf;
2001
2002 pf = isc_sockaddr_pf(&addrinfo->sockaddr);
2003 if (!have_addr) {
2004 switch (pf) {
2005 case PF_INET:
2006 result = dns_dispatch_getlocaladdress(
2007 res->dispatches4->dispatches[0],
2008 &addr);
2009 dscp = dns_resolver_getquerydscp4(fctx->res);
2010 break;
2011 case PF_INET6:
2012 result = dns_dispatch_getlocaladdress(
2013 res->dispatches6->dispatches[0],
2014 &addr);
2015 dscp = dns_resolver_getquerydscp6(fctx->res);
2016 break;
2017 default:
2018 result = ISC_R_NOTIMPLEMENTED;
2019 break;
2020 }
2021 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
2022 goto cleanup_query;
2023 }
2024 isc_sockaddr_setport(&addr, 0);
2025 if (query->dscp == -1)
2026 query->dscp = dscp;
2027
2028 result = isc_socket_create(res->socketmgr, pf,
2029 isc_sockettype_tcp,
2030 &query->tcpsocket);
2031 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
2032 goto cleanup_query;
2033
2034#ifndef BROKEN_TCP_BIND_BEFORE_CONNECT
2035 result = isc_socket_bind(query->tcpsocket, &addr, 0);
2036 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
2037 goto cleanup_socket;
2038#endif
2039 /*
2040 * A dispatch will be created once the connect succeeds.
2041 */
2042 } else {
2043 if (have_addr) {
2044 unsigned int attrs, attrmask;
2045 attrs = DNS_DISPATCHATTR_UDP;
2046 switch (isc_sockaddr_pf(&addr)) {
2047 case AF_INET:
2048 attrs |= DNS_DISPATCHATTR_IPV4;
2049 dscp = dns_resolver_getquerydscp4(fctx->res);
2050 break;
2051 case AF_INET6:
2052 attrs |= DNS_DISPATCHATTR_IPV6;
2053 dscp = dns_resolver_getquerydscp6(fctx->res);
2054 break;
2055 default:
2056 result = ISC_R_NOTIMPLEMENTED;
2057 goto cleanup_query;
2058 }
2059 attrmask = DNS_DISPATCHATTR_UDP;
2060 attrmask |= DNS_DISPATCHATTR_TCP;
2061 attrmask |= DNS_DISPATCHATTR_IPV4;
2062 attrmask |= DNS_DISPATCHATTR_IPV6;
2063 result = dns_dispatch_getudp(res->dispatchmgr,
2064 res->socketmgr,
2065 res->taskmgr, &addr,
2066 4096, 20000, 32768, 16411,
2067 16433, attrs, attrmask,
2068 &query->dispatch);
2069 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
2070 goto cleanup_query;
2071 } else {
2072 switch (isc_sockaddr_pf(&addrinfo->sockaddr)) {
2073 case PF_INET:
2074 dns_dispatch_attach(
2075 dns_resolver_dispatchv4(res),
2076 &query->dispatch);
2077 query->exclusivesocket = res->exclusivev4;
2078 dscp = dns_resolver_getquerydscp4(fctx->res);
2079 break;
2080 case PF_INET6:
2081 dns_dispatch_attach(
2082 dns_resolver_dispatchv6(res),
2083 &query->dispatch);
2084 query->exclusivesocket = res->exclusivev6;
2085 dscp = dns_resolver_getquerydscp6(fctx->res);
2086 break;
2087 default:
2088 result = ISC_R_NOTIMPLEMENTED;
2089 goto cleanup_query;
2090 }
2091 }
2092
2093 if (query->dscp == -1)
2094 query->dscp = dscp;
2095 /*
2096 * We should always have a valid dispatcher here. If we
2097 * don't support a protocol family, then its dispatcher
2098 * will be NULL, but we shouldn't be finding addresses for
2099 * protocol types we don't support, so the dispatcher
2100 * we found should never be NULL.
2101 */
2102 INSIST(query->dispatch != NULL);
2103 }
2104
2105 query->dispentry = NULL;
2106 query->fctx = fctx; /* reference added by caller */
2107 query->tsig = NULL;
2108 query->tsigkey = NULL;
2109 ISC_LINK_INIT(query, link);
2110 query->magic = QUERY_MAGIC;
2111
2112 if ((query->options & DNS_FETCHOPT_TCP) != 0) {
2113 /*
2114 * Connect to the remote server.
2115 *
2116 * XXXRTH Should we attach to the socket?
2117 */
2118 if (query->dscp != -1)
2119 isc_socket_dscp(query->tcpsocket, query->dscp);
2120 result = isc_socket_connect(query->tcpsocket,
2121 &addrinfo->sockaddr, task,
2122 resquery_connected, query);
2123 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
2124 goto cleanup_socket;
2125 query->connects++;
2126 QTRACE("connecting via TCP");
2127 } else {
2128 if (dns_adbentry_overquota(addrinfo->entry))
2129 goto cleanup_dispatch;
2130
2131 /* Inform the ADB that we're starting a fetch */
2132 dns_adb_beginudpfetch(fctx->adb, addrinfo);
2133
2134 result = resquery_send(query);
2135 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
2136 goto cleanup_dispatch;
2137 }
2138
2139 fctx->querysent++;
2140
2141 ISC_LIST_APPEND(fctx->queries, query, link);
2142 query->fctx->nqueries++;
2143 if (isc_sockaddr_pf(&addrinfo->sockaddr) == PF_INET)
2144 inc_stats(res, dns_resstatscounter_queryv4);
2145 else
2146 inc_stats(res, dns_resstatscounter_queryv6);
2147 if (res->view->resquerystats != NULL)
2148 dns_rdatatypestats_increment(res->view->resquerystats,
2149 fctx->type);
2150
2151 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
2152
2153 cleanup_socket:
2154 isc_socket_detach(&query->tcpsocket);
2155
2156 cleanup_dispatch:
2157 if (query->dispatch != NULL)
2158 dns_dispatch_detach(&query->dispatch);
2159
2160 cleanup_query:
2161 if (query->connects == 0) {
2162 query->magic = 0;
2163 isc_mem_put(fctx->mctx, query, sizeof(*query));
2164 }
2165
2166 stop_idle_timer:
2167 RUNTIME_CHECK(fctx_stopidletimer(fctx) == ISC_R_SUCCESS);
2168
2169 return (result);
2170}
2171
2172static bool
2173bad_edns(fetchctx_t *fctx, isc_sockaddr_t *address) {
2174 isc_sockaddr_t *sa;
2175
2176 for (sa = ISC_LIST_HEAD(fctx->bad_edns);
2177 sa != NULL;
2178 sa = ISC_LIST_NEXT(sa, link)) {
2179 if (isc_sockaddr_equal(sa, address))
2180 return (true);
2181 }
2182
2183 return (false);
2184}
2185
2186static void
2187add_bad_edns(fetchctx_t *fctx, isc_sockaddr_t *address) {
2188 isc_sockaddr_t *sa;
2189
2190#ifdef ENABLE_AFL
2191 if (dns_fuzzing_resolver)
2192 return;
2193#endif
2194 if (bad_edns(fctx, address))
2195 return;
2196
2197 sa = isc_mem_get(fctx->mctx, sizeof(*sa));
2198 if (sa == NULL)
2199 return;
2200
2201 *sa = *address;
2202 ISC_LIST_INITANDAPPEND(fctx->bad_edns, sa, link);
2203}
2204
2205static struct tried *
2206triededns(fetchctx_t *fctx, isc_sockaddr_t *address) {
2207 struct tried *tried;
2208
2209 for (tried = ISC_LIST_HEAD(fctx->edns);
2210 tried != NULL;
2211 tried = ISC_LIST_NEXT(tried, link)) {
2212 if (isc_sockaddr_equal(&tried->addr, address))
2213 return (tried);
2214 }
2215
2216 return (NULL);
2217}
2218
2219static void
2220add_triededns(fetchctx_t *fctx, isc_sockaddr_t *address) {
2221 struct tried *tried;
2222
2223 tried = triededns(fctx, address);
2224 if (tried != NULL) {
2225 tried->count++;
2226 return;
2227 }
2228
2229 tried = isc_mem_get(fctx->mctx, sizeof(*tried));
2230 if (tried == NULL)
2231 return;
2232
2233 tried->addr = *address;
2234 tried->count = 1;
2235 ISC_LIST_INITANDAPPEND(fctx->edns, tried, link);
2236}
2237
2238static struct tried *
2239triededns512(fetchctx_t *fctx, isc_sockaddr_t *address) {
2240 struct tried *tried;
2241
2242 for (tried = ISC_LIST_HEAD(fctx->edns512);
2243 tried != NULL;
2244 tried = ISC_LIST_NEXT(tried, link)) {
2245 if (isc_sockaddr_equal(&tried->addr, address))
2246 return (tried);
2247 }
2248
2249 return (NULL);
2250}
2251
2252static void
2253add_triededns512(fetchctx_t *fctx, isc_sockaddr_t *address) {
2254 struct tried *tried;
2255
2256 tried = triededns512(fctx, address);
2257 if (tried != NULL) {
2258 tried->count++;
2259 return;
2260 }
2261
2262 tried = isc_mem_get(fctx->mctx, sizeof(*tried));
2263 if (tried == NULL)
2264 return;
2265
2266 tried->addr = *address;
2267 tried->count = 1;
2268 ISC_LIST_INITANDAPPEND(fctx->edns512, tried, link);
2269}
2270
2271static void
2272compute_cc(resquery_t *query, unsigned char *cookie, size_t len) {
2273#ifdef AES_CC
2274 unsigned char digest[ISC_AES_BLOCK_LENGTH];
2275 unsigned char input[16];
2276 isc_netaddr_t netaddr;
2277 unsigned int i;
2278
2279 INSIST(len >= 8U);
2280
2281 isc_netaddr_fromsockaddr(&netaddr, &query->addrinfo->sockaddr);
2282 switch (netaddr.family) {
2283 case AF_INET:
2284 memmove(input, (unsigned char *)&netaddr.type.in, 4);
2285 memset(input + 4, 0, 12);
2286 break;
2287 case AF_INET6:
2288 memmove(input, (unsigned char *)&netaddr.type.in6, 16);
2289 break;
2290 }
2291 isc_aes128_crypt(query->fctx->res->view->secret, input, digest);
2292 for (i = 0; i < 8; i++)
2293 digest[i] ^= digest[i + 8];
2294 memmove(cookie, digest, 8);
2295#endif
2296#if defined(HMAC_SHA1_CC) || defined(HMAC_SHA256_CC)
2297 unsigned char digest[ISC_MAX_MD_SIZE];
2298 unsigned char *input = NULL;
2299 unsigned int length = 0;
2300 isc_netaddr_t netaddr;
2301#if defined(HMAC_SHA1_CC)
2302 isc_md_type_t type = ISC_MD_SHA1;
2303 unsigned int secret_len = ISC_SHA1_DIGESTLENGTH;
2304#elif defined(HMAC_SHA256_CC)
2305 isc_md_type_t type = ISC_MD_SHA256;
2306 unsigned int secret_len = ISC_SHA256_DIGESTLENGTH;
2307#endif
2308
2309 INSIST(len >= 8U);
2310
2311 isc_netaddr_fromsockaddr(&netaddr, &query->addrinfo->sockaddr);
2312 switch (netaddr.family) {
2313 case AF_INET:
2314 input = (unsigned char *)&netaddr.type.in;
2315 length = 4;
2316 break;
2317 case AF_INET6:
2318 input = (unsigned char *)&netaddr.type.in6;
2319 length = 16;
2320 break;
2321 }
2322
2323 RUNTIME_CHECK(isc_hmac(type,
2324 query->fctx->res->view->secret, secret_len,
2325 input, length,
2326 digest, NULL) == ISC_R_SUCCESS);
2327 memmove(cookie, digest, 8);
2328#endif
2329}
2330
2331static isc_result_t
2332issecuredomain(dns_view_t *view, const dns_name_t *name, dns_rdatatype_t type,
2333 isc_stdtime_t now, bool checknta,
2334 bool *issecure)
2335{
2336 dns_name_t suffix;
2337 unsigned int labels;
2338
2339 /*
2340 * For DS variants we need to check fom the parent domain,
2341 * since there may be a negative trust anchor for the name,
2342 * while the enclosing domain where the DS record lives is
2343 * under a secure entry point.
2344 */
2345 labels = dns_name_countlabels(name);
2346 if (dns_rdatatype_atparent(type) && labels > 1) {
2347 dns_name_init(&suffix, NULL);
2348 dns_name_getlabelsequence(name, 1, labels - 1, &suffix);
2349 name = &suffix;
2350 }
2351
2352 return (dns_view_issecuredomain(view, name, now, checknta, issecure));
2353}
2354
2355static isc_result_t
2356resquery_send(resquery_t *query) {
2357 fetchctx_t *fctx;
2358 isc_result_t result;
2359 dns_name_t *qname = NULL;
2360 dns_rdataset_t *qrdataset = NULL;
2361 isc_region_t r;
2362 dns_resolver_t *res;
2363 isc_task_t *task;
2364 isc_socket_t *sock;
2365 isc_buffer_t tcpbuffer;
2366 isc_sockaddr_t *address;
2367 isc_buffer_t *buffer;
2368 isc_netaddr_t ipaddr;
2369 dns_tsigkey_t *tsigkey = NULL;
2370 dns_peer_t *peer = NULL;
2371 bool useedns;
2372 dns_compress_t cctx;
2373 bool cleanup_cctx = false;
2374 bool secure_domain;
2375 bool tcp = ((query->options & DNS_FETCHOPT_TCP) != 0);
2376 dns_ednsopt_t ednsopts[DNS_EDNSOPTIONS];
2377 unsigned ednsopt = 0;
2378 uint16_t hint = 0, udpsize = 0; /* No EDNS */
2379#ifdef HAVE_DNSTAP
2380 isc_sockaddr_t localaddr, *la = NULL;
2381 unsigned char zone[DNS_NAME_MAXWIRE];
2382 dns_dtmsgtype_t dtmsgtype;
2383 isc_region_t zr;
2384 isc_buffer_t zb;
2385#endif /* HAVE_DNSTAP */
2386
2387 fctx = query->fctx;
2388 QTRACE("send");
2389
2390 res = fctx->res;
2391 task = res->buckets[fctx->bucketnum].task;
2392 address = NULL;
2393
2394 if (tcp) {
2395 /*
2396 * Reserve space for the TCP message length.
2397 */
2398 isc_buffer_init(&tcpbuffer, query->data, sizeof(query->data));
2399 isc_buffer_init(&query->buffer, query->data + 2,
2400 sizeof(query->data) - 2);
2401 buffer = &tcpbuffer;
2402 } else {
2403 isc_buffer_init(&query->buffer, query->data,
2404 sizeof(query->data));
2405 buffer = &query->buffer;
2406 }
2407
2408 result = dns_message_gettempname(fctx->qmessage, &qname);
2409 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
2410 goto cleanup_temps;
2411 result = dns_message_gettemprdataset(fctx->qmessage, &qrdataset);
2412 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
2413 goto cleanup_temps;
2414
2415 /*
2416 * Get a query id from the dispatch.
2417 */
2418 result = dns_dispatch_addresponse(query->dispatch,
2419 0,
2420 &query->addrinfo->sockaddr,
2421 task,
2422 resquery_response,
2423 query,
2424 &query->id,
2425 &query->dispentry,
2426 res->socketmgr);
2427 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
2428 goto cleanup_temps;
2429
2430 fctx->qmessage->opcode = dns_opcode_query;
2431
2432 /*
2433 * Set up question.
2434 */
2435 dns_name_init(qname, NULL);
2436 dns_name_clone(&fctx->name, qname);
2437 dns_rdataset_makequestion(qrdataset, res->rdclass, fctx->type);
2438 ISC_LIST_APPEND(qname->list, qrdataset, link);
2439 dns_message_addname(fctx->qmessage, qname, DNS_SECTION_QUESTION);
2440 qname = NULL;
2441 qrdataset = NULL;
2442
2443 /*
2444 * Set RD if the client has requested that we do a recursive query,
2445 * or if we're sending to a forwarder.
2446 */
2447 if ((query->options & DNS_FETCHOPT_RECURSIVE) != 0 ||
2448 ISFORWARDER(query->addrinfo))
2449 fctx->qmessage->flags |= DNS_MESSAGEFLAG_RD;
2450
2451 /*
2452 * Set CD if the client says not to validate, or if the
2453 * question is under a secure entry point and this is a
2454 * recursive/forward query -- unless the client said not to.
2455 */
2456 if ((query->options & DNS_FETCHOPT_NOCDFLAG) != 0)
2457 /* Do nothing */
2458 ;
2459 else if ((query->options & DNS_FETCHOPT_NOVALIDATE) != 0)
2460 fctx->qmessage->flags |= DNS_MESSAGEFLAG_CD;
2461 else if (res->view->enablevalidation &&
2462 ((fctx->qmessage->flags & DNS_MESSAGEFLAG_RD) != 0))
2463 {
2464 bool checknta = ((query->options & DNS_FETCHOPT_NONTA) == 0);
2465 result = issecuredomain(res->view, &fctx->name, fctx->type,
2466 isc_time_seconds(&query->start),
2467 checknta, &secure_domain);
2468 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
2469 secure_domain = false;
2470 if (res->view->dlv != NULL)
2471 secure_domain = true;
2472 if (secure_domain)
2473 fctx->qmessage->flags |= DNS_MESSAGEFLAG_CD;
2474 }
2475
2476 /*
2477 * We don't have to set opcode because it defaults to query.
2478 */
2479 fctx->qmessage->id = query->id;
2480
2481 /*
2482 * Convert the question to wire format.
2483 */
2484 result = dns_compress_init(&cctx, -1, fctx->res->mctx);
2485 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
2486 goto cleanup_message;
2487 cleanup_cctx = true;
2488
2489 result = dns_message_renderbegin(fctx->qmessage, &cctx,
2490 &query->buffer);
2491 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
2492 goto cleanup_message;
2493
2494 result = dns_message_rendersection(fctx->qmessage,
2495 DNS_SECTION_QUESTION, 0);
2496 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
2497 goto cleanup_message;
2498
2499 peer = NULL;
2500 isc_netaddr_fromsockaddr(&ipaddr, &query->addrinfo->sockaddr);
2501 (void) dns_peerlist_peerbyaddr(fctx->res->view->peers, &ipaddr, &peer);
2502
2503 /*
2504 * The ADB does not know about servers with "edns no". Check this,
2505 * and then inform the ADB for future use.
2506 */
2507 if ((query->addrinfo->flags & DNS_FETCHOPT_NOEDNS0) == 0 &&
2508 peer != NULL &&
2509 dns_peer_getsupportedns(peer, &useedns) == ISC_R_SUCCESS &&
2510 !useedns)
2511 {
2512 query->options |= DNS_FETCHOPT_NOEDNS0;
2513 dns_adb_changeflags(fctx->adb, query->addrinfo,
2514 DNS_FETCHOPT_NOEDNS0,
2515 DNS_FETCHOPT_NOEDNS0);
2516 }
2517
2518 /* Sync NOEDNS0 flag in addrinfo->flags and options now. */
2519 if ((query->addrinfo->flags & DNS_FETCHOPT_NOEDNS0) != 0)
2520 query->options |= DNS_FETCHOPT_NOEDNS0;
2521
2522 if (fctx->timeout && (query->options & DNS_FETCHOPT_NOEDNS0) == 0) {
2523 isc_sockaddr_t *sockaddr = &query->addrinfo->sockaddr;
2524 struct tried *tried;
2525
2526 if ((tried = triededns(fctx, sockaddr)) != NULL) {
2527 if (tried->count == 1U) {
2528 hint = dns_adb_getudpsize(fctx->adb,
2529 query->addrinfo);
2530 } else if (tried->count >= 2U) {
2531 query->options |= DNS_FETCHOPT_EDNS512;
2532 fctx->reason = "reducing the advertised EDNS "
2533 "UDP packet size to 512 octets";
2534 }
2535 }
2536 }
2537 fctx->timeout = false;
2538
2539 /*
2540 * Use EDNS0, unless the caller doesn't want it, or we know that the
2541 * remote server doesn't like it.
2542 */
2543 if ((query->options & DNS_FETCHOPT_NOEDNS0) == 0) {
2544 if ((query->addrinfo->flags & DNS_FETCHOPT_NOEDNS0) == 0) {
2545 unsigned int version = DNS_EDNS_VERSION;
2546 unsigned int flags = query->addrinfo->flags;
2547 bool reqnsid = res->view->requestnsid;
2548 bool sendcookie = res->view->sendcookie;
2549 bool tcpkeepalive = false;
2550 unsigned char cookie[64];
2551 uint16_t padding = 0;
2552
2553 if ((flags & FCTX_ADDRINFO_EDNSOK) != 0 &&
2554 (query->options & DNS_FETCHOPT_EDNS512) == 0) {
2555 udpsize = dns_adb_probesize(fctx->adb,
2556 query->addrinfo,
2557 fctx->timeouts);
2558 if (udpsize > res->udpsize)
2559 udpsize = res->udpsize;
2560 }
2561
2562 if (peer != NULL)
2563 (void)dns_peer_getudpsize(peer, &udpsize);
2564
2565 if (udpsize == 0U && res->udpsize == 512U)
2566 udpsize = 512;
2567
2568 /*
2569 * Was the size forced to 512 in the configuration?
2570 */
2571 if (udpsize == 512U)
2572 query->options |= DNS_FETCHOPT_EDNS512;
2573
2574 /*
2575 * We have talked to this server before.
2576 */
2577 if (hint != 0U)
2578 udpsize = hint;
2579
2580 /*
2581 * We know nothing about the peer's capabilities
2582 * so start with minimal EDNS UDP size.
2583 */
2584 if (udpsize == 0U)
2585 udpsize = 512;
2586
2587 if ((flags & DNS_FETCHOPT_EDNSVERSIONSET) != 0) {
2588 version = flags & DNS_FETCHOPT_EDNSVERSIONMASK;
2589 version >>= DNS_FETCHOPT_EDNSVERSIONSHIFT;
2590 }
2591
2592 /* Request NSID/COOKIE/VERSION for current peer? */
2593 if (peer != NULL) {
2594 uint8_t ednsversion;
2595 (void) dns_peer_getrequestnsid(peer, &reqnsid);
2596 (void) dns_peer_getsendcookie(peer,
2597 &sendcookie);
2598 result = dns_peer_getednsversion(peer,
2599 &ednsversion);
2600 if (result == ISC_R_SUCCESS &&
2601 ednsversion < version)
2602 version = ednsversion;
2603 }
2604 if (NOCOOKIE(query->addrinfo))
2605 sendcookie = false;
2606 if (reqnsid) {
2607 INSIST(ednsopt < DNS_EDNSOPTIONS);
2608 ednsopts[ednsopt].code = DNS_OPT_NSID;
2609 ednsopts[ednsopt].length = 0;
2610 ednsopts[ednsopt].value = NULL;
2611 ednsopt++;
2612 }
2613 if (sendcookie) {
2614 INSIST(ednsopt < DNS_EDNSOPTIONS);
2615 ednsopts[ednsopt].code = DNS_OPT_COOKIE;
2616 ednsopts[ednsopt].length = (uint16_t)
2617 dns_adb_getcookie(fctx->adb,
2618 query->addrinfo,
2619 cookie,
2620 sizeof(cookie));
2621 if (ednsopts[ednsopt].length != 0) {
2622 ednsopts[ednsopt].value = cookie;
2623 inc_stats(fctx->res,
2624 dns_resstatscounter_cookieout);
2625 } else {
2626 compute_cc(query, cookie, 8);
2627 ednsopts[ednsopt].value = cookie;
2628 ednsopts[ednsopt].length = 8;
2629 inc_stats(fctx->res,
2630 dns_resstatscounter_cookienew);
2631 }
2632 ednsopt++;
2633 }
2634
2635 /* Add TCP keepalive option if appropriate */
2636 if ((peer != NULL) && tcp)
2637 (void) dns_peer_gettcpkeepalive(peer,
2638 &tcpkeepalive);
2639 if (tcpkeepalive) {
2640 INSIST(ednsopt < DNS_EDNSOPTIONS);
2641 ednsopts[ednsopt].code = DNS_OPT_TCP_KEEPALIVE;
2642 ednsopts[ednsopt].length = 0;
2643 ednsopts[ednsopt].value = NULL;
2644 ednsopt++;
2645 }
2646
2647 /* Add PAD for current peer? Require TCP for now */
2648 if ((peer != NULL) && tcp)
2649 (void) dns_peer_getpadding(peer, &padding);
2650 if (padding != 0) {
2651 INSIST(ednsopt < DNS_EDNSOPTIONS);
2652 ednsopts[ednsopt].code = DNS_OPT_PAD;
2653 ednsopts[ednsopt].length = 0;
2654 ednsopt++;
2655 dns_message_setpadding(fctx->qmessage,
2656 padding);
2657 }
2658
2659 query->ednsversion = version;
2660 result = fctx_addopt(fctx->qmessage, version,
2661 udpsize, ednsopts, ednsopt);
2662 if (reqnsid && result == ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
2663 query->options |= DNS_FETCHOPT_WANTNSID;
2664 } else if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
2665 /*
2666 * We couldn't add the OPT, but we'll press on.
2667 * We're not using EDNS0, so set the NOEDNS0
2668 * bit.
2669 */
2670 query->options |= DNS_FETCHOPT_NOEDNS0;
2671 query->ednsversion = -1;
2672 udpsize = 0;
2673 }
2674 } else {
2675 /*
2676 * We know this server doesn't like EDNS0, so we
2677 * won't use it. Set the NOEDNS0 bit since we're
2678 * not using EDNS0.
2679 */
2680 query->options |= DNS_FETCHOPT_NOEDNS0;
2681 query->ednsversion = -1;
2682 }
2683 } else
2684 query->ednsversion = -1;
2685
2686 /*
2687 * Record the UDP EDNS size choosen.
2688 */
2689 query->udpsize = udpsize;
2690
2691 /*
2692 * If we need EDNS0 to do this query and aren't using it, we lose.
2693 */
2694 if (NEEDEDNS0(fctx) && (query->options & DNS_FETCHOPT_NOEDNS0) != 0) {
2695 result = DNS_R_SERVFAIL;
2696 goto cleanup_message;
2697 }
2698
2699 if (udpsize > 512U)
2700 add_triededns(fctx, &query->addrinfo->sockaddr);
2701
2702 if (udpsize == 512U)
2703 add_triededns512(fctx, &query->addrinfo->sockaddr);
2704
2705 /*
2706 * Clear CD if EDNS is not in use.
2707 */
2708 if ((query->options & DNS_FETCHOPT_NOEDNS0) != 0)
2709 fctx->qmessage->flags &= ~DNS_MESSAGEFLAG_CD;
2710
2711 /*
2712 * Add TSIG record tailored to the current recipient.
2713 */
2714 result = dns_view_getpeertsig(fctx->res->view, &ipaddr, &tsigkey);
2715 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS && result != ISC_R_NOTFOUND)
2716 goto cleanup_message;
2717
2718 if (tsigkey != NULL) {
2719 result = dns_message_settsigkey(fctx->qmessage, tsigkey);
2720 dns_tsigkey_detach(&tsigkey);
2721 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
2722 goto cleanup_message;
2723 }
2724
2725 result = dns_message_rendersection(fctx->qmessage,
2726 DNS_SECTION_ADDITIONAL, 0);
2727 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
2728 goto cleanup_message;
2729
2730 result = dns_message_renderend(fctx->qmessage);
2731 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
2732 goto cleanup_message;
2733
2734#ifdef HAVE_DNSTAP
2735 memset(&zr, 0, sizeof(zr));
2736 isc_buffer_init(&zb, zone, sizeof(zone));
2737 dns_compress_setmethods(&cctx, DNS_COMPRESS_NONE);
2738 result = dns_name_towire(&fctx->domain, &cctx, &zb);
2739 if (result == ISC_R_SUCCESS)
2740 isc_buffer_usedregion(&zb, &zr);
2741#endif /* HAVE_DNSTAP */
2742
2743 dns_compress_invalidate(&cctx);
2744 cleanup_cctx = false;
2745
2746 if (dns_message_gettsigkey(fctx->qmessage) != NULL) {
2747 dns_tsigkey_attach(dns_message_gettsigkey(fctx->qmessage),
2748 &query->tsigkey);
2749 result = dns_message_getquerytsig(fctx->qmessage,
2750 fctx->res->mctx,
2751 &query->tsig);
2752 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
2753 goto cleanup_message;
2754 }
2755
2756 /*
2757 * If using TCP, write the length of the message at the beginning
2758 * of the buffer.
2759 */
2760 if (tcp) {
2761 isc_buffer_usedregion(&query->buffer, &r);
2762 isc_buffer_putuint16(&tcpbuffer, (uint16_t)r.length);
2763 isc_buffer_add(&tcpbuffer, r.length);
2764 }
2765
2766 /*
2767 * Log the outgoing packet.
2768 */
